quote: Some say the world will end in fire,
author: Robert Frost

quote: Life is to be enjoyed, not endured
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: Now, you two  this year, you behave yourselves. If I get one more owl telling me you've  you've blown up a toilet or
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: You can't be happy unless you're unhappy sometimes.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: All endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Nothing is so painful to the human mind as a great and sudden change.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

quote: You see, cuckoos are parasites. They lay their eggs in other birds' nests. When the egg hatches, the baby cuckoo pushes the other baby birds out of the nest. The poor parent birds work themselves to death trying to find enough food to feed the enormous cuckoo child who has murdered their babies and taken their places.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Among other things, you'll find that you're not the first person who was ever confused and frightened and even sickened by human behavior. You're by no means alone on that score, you'll be excited and stimulated to know. Many, many men have been just as troubled morally and spiritually as you are right now. Happily, some of them kept records of their troubles. You'll learn from themif you want to. Just as someday, if you have something to offer, someone will learn something from you. It's a beautiful reciprocal arrangement. And it isn't education. It's history. It's poetry.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: Why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time. My greatest regret was how much I believed in the future.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: When you stop expecting people to be perfect, you can like them for who they are.
author: Donald Miller

quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: There is no real ending. Its just the place where you stop the story.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: I fell in love with her courage, her sincerity, and her flaming self respect. And it's these things I'd believe in, even if the whole world indulged in wild suspicions that she wasn't all she should be. I love her and it is the beginning of everything.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me.
author: Emerson, Ralph Waldo

quote: More smiling, less worrying. More compassion, less judgment. More blessed, less stressed. More love, less hate.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing.
author: sylvia plath

quote: After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: You're off to Great Places!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Out of the corner of her eye she thought she saw Jace shoot her a look of white rage - but when she glanced at him, he looked as he always did: easy, confident, slightly bored.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Don't Panic.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of.
author: Gregory Maguire

quote: A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: We are all different. Dont judge, understand instead.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Usually I'm remarkably good natured. Try me on a day that doesn't end in y.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Learn what is to be taken seriously and laugh at the rest.
author: Herman Hesse

quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: It's enough for me to be sure that you and I exist at this moment.
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: Both Rowling and Meyer, theyre speaking directly to young people.  The real difference is that Jo Rowling is a terrific writer and Stephenie Meyer cant write worth a darn. Shes not very good.
author: Stephen King

quote: Hate the sin, love the sinner.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: To see a World in a Grain of Sand
author: William Blake

quote: There was a clatter as the basilisk fangs cascaded out of Hermione's arms. Running at Ron, she flung them around his neck and kissed him full on the mouth. Ron threw away the fangs and broomstick he was holding and responded with such enthusiasm that he lifted Hermione off her feet.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Many people lose the small joys in the hope for the big happiness.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: I go to seek a Great Perhaps.
author: François Rabelais

quote: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Live to the point of tears.
author: Albert Camus

quote: You are imperfect, permanently and inevitably flawed. And you are beautiful.
author: Amy Bloom

quote: Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quote: Remember that wherever your heart is, there you will find your treasure.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other peoples hands.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: All I ever wanted was to reach out and touch another human being not just with my hands but with my heart.
author: Tahereh Mafi

quote: There are no facts, only interpretations.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He's a wallflower. You see things. You keep quiet about them. And you understand.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: Well, now
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul
author: Victor Hugo

quote: If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: We have to allow ourselves to be loved by the people who really love us, the people who really matter. Too much of the time, we are blinded by our own pursuits of people to love us, people that don't even matter, while all that time we waste and the people who do love us have to stand on the sidewalk and watch us beg in the streets! It's time to put an end to this. It's time for us to let ourselves be loved.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Ah, said a voice from the doorway, having your annual everyone thinks Will is a lunatic meeting, are you?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
author: Bukkyo Dendo Kyokai

quote: I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: If you have two friends in your lifetime, you're lucky. If you have one good friend, you're more than lucky.
author: S.E. Hinton

quote: A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say.
author: Italo Calvino

quote: All the world's a stage,
author: William Shakespeare

quote: If no one in the entire world cared about you, did you really exist at all?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The greater the love, the greater the tragedy when it's over.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: This is your life and its ending one moment at a time.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Find what you love and let it kill you.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
author: Voltaire

quote: Some birds are not meant to be caged, that's all. Their feathers are too bright, their songs too sweet and wild. So you let them go, or when you open the cage to feed them they somehow fly out past you. And the part of you that knows it was wrong to imprison them in the first place rejoices, but still, the place where you live is that much more drab and empty for their departure.
author: Stephen King

quote: The thing about growing up with Fred and George, said Ginny thoughtfully, is that you sort of start thinking anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: What you do, the way you think, makes you beautiful.
author: Scott Westerfeld

quote: Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: One love, one heart, one destiny.
author: Robert Marley

quote: Look again at that dot. That's here. That's home. That's us. On it everyone you love, everyone you know, everyone you ever heard of, every human being who ever was, lived out their lives. The aggregate of our joy and suffering, thousands of confident religions, ideologies, and economic doctrines, every hunter and forager, every hero and coward, every creator and destroyer of civilization, every king and peasant, every young couple in love, every mother and father, hopeful child, inventor and explorer, every teacher of morals, every corrupt politician, every superstar, every supreme leader, every saint and sinner in the history of our species lived there-on a mote of dust suspended in a sunbeam.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: To burn with desire and keep quiet about it is the greatest punishment we can bring on ourselves.
author: Federico García Lorca

quote: To define is to limit.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: If you gave someone your heart and they died, did they take it with them? Did you spend the rest of forever with a hole inside you that couldn't be filled?
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: Don't take life too seriously. Punch it in the face when it needs a good hit. Laugh at it.
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: That was the thing. You never got used to it, the idea of someone being gone. Just when you think it's reconciled, accepted, someone points it out to you, and it just hits you all over again, that shocking.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Lets not forget this.
author: Dave Eggers

quote: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I, myself, am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions.
author: Augusten Burroughs

quote: I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of sceneryair, mountains, trees, people. I thought, This is what it is to be happy.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Do your thing and don't care if they like it.
author: Tina Fey

quote: It's not because I want to make out with her.
author: John Green

quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books.
author: Irving Stone

quote: A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.
author: mahatma gandhi

quote: If she's amazing, she won't be easy. If she's easy, she won't be amazing. If she's worth it, you wont give up. If you give up, you're not worthy. ... Truth is, everybody is going to hurt you; you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.
author: Bob Marley

quote: I was thinking about the first time I ever saw you, he said, and how after that I couldn't forget you. I wanted to, but I couldn't stop myself. I forced Hodge to let me be the one who came to find you and bring you back to the Institue. And even back then, in that stupid coffee shop, when I saw you sitting on that couch with Simon, even then that felt wrong to me-- I should have been the one sitting with you. The one who made you laugh like that. I couldn't get rid of that feeling. That it should have been me. And the more I knew you, the more I felt it--it had never been like that for me before. I'd always wanted a girl and then gotten to know her and not wanted her anymore, but with you the feeling just got stronger and stronger until that night when you showed up at Renwick's and I knew.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Is standing by the window muttering about blood something he does all the time? asked Simon.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Today a reader, tomorrow a leader.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Forever is composed of nows.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: It's not the face, but the expressions on it. It's not the voice, but what you say. It's not how you look in that body, but the thing you do with it. You are beautiful.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: Goodbye, said the fox. And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: But a mermaid has no tears, and therefore she suffers so much more.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: So be sure when you step, Step with care and great tact. And remember that life's A Great Balancing Act. And will you succeed? Yes! You will, indeed! (98 and  percent guaranteed) Kid, you'll move mountains.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: What are men to rocks and mountains?
author: Jane Austen

quote: Life is too short to waste your time on people who dont respect, appreciate, and value you.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Sometimes it seems safer to hold it all in, where the only person who can judge is yourself.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: For me, trees have always been the most penetrating preachers. I revere them when they live in tribes and families, in forests and groves. And even more I revere them when they stand alone. They are like lonely persons. Not like hermits who have stolen away out of some weakness, but like great, solitary men, like Beethoven and Nietzsche. In their highest boughs the world rustles, their roots rest in infinity; but they do not lose themselves there, they struggle with all the force of their lives for one thing only: to fulfil themselves according to their own laws, to build up their own form, to represent themselves. Nothing is holier, nothing is more exemplary than a beautiful, strong tree. When a tree is cut down and reveals its naked death-wound to the sun, one can read its whole history in the luminous, inscribed disk of its trunk: in the rings of its years, its scars, all the struggle, all the suffering, all the sickness, all the happiness and prosperity stand truly written, the narrow years and the luxurious years, the attacks withstood, the storms endured. And every young farmboy knows that the hardest and noblest wood has the narrowest rings, that high on the mountains and in continuing danger the most indestructible, the strongest, the ideal trees grow.
author: Herman Hesse

quote: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: When someone is crying, of course, the noble thing to do is to comfort them. But if someone is trying to hide their tears, it may also be noble to pretend you do not notice them.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Reading is escape, and the opposite of escape; it's a way to make contact with reality after a day of making things up, and it's a way of making contact with someone else's imagination after a day that's all too real.
author: Nora Ephron

quote: No matter how much suffering you went through, you never wanted to let go of those memories.
author: haruki murakami

quote: It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal.
author: E.M. Forster

quote: And so it goes...
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Confront the dark parts of yourself, and work to banish them with illumination and forgiveness. Your willingness to wrestle with your demons will cause your angels to sing.
author: August Wilson

quote: I do things like get in a taxi and say, The library, and step on it.
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.
author: JK Rowling

quote: Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind.
author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

quote: Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk.
author: Robert Bloch

quote: Oh well... I'd just been thinking, if you had died, you'd have been welcome to share my toilet.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: The Road goes ever on and on
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: At some point, you just pull off the Band-Aid, and it hurts, but then it's over and you're relieved.
author: John Green

quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Tell your heart that the fear of suffering is worse than the suffering itself. And that no heart has ever suffered when it goes in search of its dreams, because every second of the search is a second's encounter with God and with eternity.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Dance, when you're broken open. Dance, if you've torn the bandage off. Dance in the middle of the fighting. Dance in your blood. Dance when you're perfectly free.
author: Rumi

quote: When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: I dream my painting and I paint my dream.
author: Vincent Willem van Gogh

quote: The silence depressed me. It wasn't the silence of silence. It was my own silence.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep.
author: Clive Barker

quote: If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph:
author: kurt vonnegut

quote: You don't remember what happened. What you remember becomes what happened.
author: John Green

quote: And I like large parties. Theyre so intimate. At small parties there isnt any privacy.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: There is a stubbornness about me that never can bear to be frightened at the will of others. My courage always rises at every attempt to intimidate me.
author: Jane Austen

quote: People are more difficult to work with than machines. And when you break a person, he can't be fixed.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Isabelle drifted over, Jace a pace behind her. She was wearing a long black dress with boots and an even longer cutaway coat of soft green velvet, the color of moss. I can't believe you did it! she exclaimed. How did you get Magnus to let Jace leave?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: You is kind. You is smart. You is important.
author: Kathryn Stockett

quote: You do not have to be good.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: I lived in books more than I lived anywhere else.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: It was books that made me feel that perhaps I was not completely alone. They could be honest with me, and I with them.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Don't stop there. I suppose there are also, what, vampires and werewolves and zombies?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Be the reason someone smiles. Be the reason someone feels loved and believes in the goodness in people.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: It happens to everyone as they grow up. You find out who you are and what you want, and then you realize that people you've known forever don't see things the way you do. So you keep the wonderful memories, but find yourself moving on.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: If a book about failures doesn't sell, is it a success?
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?
author: Anais Nin

quote: Fighting for peace is like screwing for virginity.
author: George Carlin

quote: I don't want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Maybe you can afford to wait. Maybe for you there's a tomorrow. Maybe for you there's one thousand tomorrows, or three thousand, or ten, so much time you can bathe in it, roll around it, let it slide like coins through you fingers. So much time you can waste it.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: Wherever you go becomes a part of you somehow.
author: Anita Desai

quote: Happiness is the consequence of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestations of your own blessings. And once you have achieved a state of happiness, you must never become lax about maintaining it. You must make a mighty effort to keep swimming upward into that happiness forever, to stay afloat on top of it.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be.
author: Orson Scott Card

quote: For last year's words belong to last year's language
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: Isn't it odd how much fatter a book gets when you've read it several times? Mo had said...As if something were left between the pages every time you read it. Feelings, thoughts, sounds, smells...and then, when you look at the book again many years later, you find yourself there, too, a slightly younger self, slightly different, as if the book had preserved you like a pressed flower...both strange and familiar.
author: Cornelia Funke

quote: You know, when it works, love is pretty amazing. It's not overrated. There's a reason for all those songs.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: They say when you are missing someone that they are probably feeling the same, but I don't think it's possible for you to miss me as much as I'm missing you right now
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Fall down again, Bella?'
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Solitude is fine but you need someone to tell that solitude is fine.
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: Do you wish me a good morning, or mean that it is a good morning whether I want it or not; or that you feel good this morning; or that it is a morning to be good on?
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Do what is right, not what is easy nor what is popular.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Accept yourself, love yourself, and keep moving forward. If you want to fly, you have to give up what weighs you down.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Say 'provoking' again. Your mouth looks provocative when you do.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I want
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book. And then there are books like An Imperial Affliction, which you can't tell people about, books so special and rare and yours that advertising your affection feels like betrayal
author: John Green

quote: And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: To me, Fearless is not the absense of fear. It's not being completely unafraid. To me, Fearless is having fears. Fearless is having doubts. Lots of them. To me, Fearless is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?
author: Rumi

quote: Understanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: And still, after all this time,
author: Hafiz

quote: The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.
author: George Orwell

quote: You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The world was hers for the reading.
author: Betty Smith

quote: I love you like a fat kid loves cake!
author: Scott Adams

quote: Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?
author: Audrey Niffenegger

quote: When I was a boy of 14, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be 21, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Why are women... so much more interesting to men than men are to women?
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Atticus told me to delete the adjectives and I'd have the facts.
author: Harper Lee

quote: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: I can resist anything except temptation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The first draft of anything is shit.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: How did it get so late so soon?
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Imagine smiling after a slap in the face. Then think of doing it twenty-four hours a day.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: And when her lips met mine, I knew that I could live to be a hundred and visit every country in the world, but nothing would ever compare to that single moment when I first kissed the girl of my dreams and knew that my love would last forever.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Live the Life of Your Dreams: Be brave enough to live the life of your dreams according to your vision and purpose instead of the expectations and opinions of others.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: What makes the desert beautiful,' said the little prince, 'is that somewhere it hides a well...
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Maybe everbody in the whole damn world is scared of each other.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Though nobody can go back and make a new beginning... Anyone can start over and make a new ending.
author: Chico Xavier

quote: Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live.
author: Natalie Babbitt

quote: I am an excitable person who only understands life lyrically, musically, in whom feelings are much stronger as reason. I am so thirsty for the marvelous that only the marvelous has power over me. Anything I can not transform into something marvelous, I let go. Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
author: Anais Nin

quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.
author: Colette

quote: I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee.
author: J.R. Ward

quote: Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.
author: Christopher Paolini

quote: You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?
author: Rumi

quote: There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It doesn't interest me what you do for a living. I want to know what you ache for, and if you dare to dream of meeting your heart's longing.
author: Oriah Mountain Dreamer

quote: So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Its probably not just by chance that Im alone. It would be very hard for a man to live with me, unless hes terribly strong. And if hes stronger than I, Im the one who cant live with him.  Im neither smart nor stupid, but I dont think Im a run-of-the-mill person. Ive been in business without being a businesswoman, Ive loved without being a woman made only for love. The two men Ive loved, I think, will remember me, on earth or in heaven, because men always remember a woman who caused them concern and uneasiness. Ive done my best, in regard to people and to life, without precepts, but with a taste for justice.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: I'm quite illiterate, but I read a lot.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: You speak an infinite deal of nothing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: You need to learn how to select your thoughts just the same way you select your clothes every day. This is a power you can cultivate. If you want to control things in your life so bad, work on the mind. That's the only thing you should be trying to control.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: It's just that most really good-looking people are stupid, so I exceed expectations.'
author: John Green

quote: You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.
author: Malcolm X

quote: He does something to me, that boy. Every time. Its his only detriment. He steps on my heart. He makes me cry.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: The past is a place of reference, not a place of residence; the past is a place of learning, not a place of living.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
author: Rumi

quote: To say goodbye is to die a little.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
author: Fitzgerald F. Scott

quote: So you're always honest, I said.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: No. I can survive well enough on my own if given the proper reading material.
author: Sarah J. Maas

quote: You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace.
author: Frank McCourt

quote: When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.
author: Rumi

quote: Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?
author: Christopher Paolini

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Grover was sniffing the wind, looking nervous. He fished out his acorns and threw them into the sand, then played his pipes. They rearranged themselves in a pattern that made no sense to me, but Grover looked concerned.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: As if you were on fire from within.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved.
author: Stewart O'Nan

quote: All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Even death has a heart.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: You must make a decision that you are going to move on. It wont happen automatically. You will have to rise up and say, I dont care how hard this is, I dont care how disappointed I am, Im not going to let this get the best of me. Im moving on with my life.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: It's a lot easier to be lost than found. It's the reason we're always searching and rarely discovered--so many locks not enough keys.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation.
author: Walter Cronkite

quote: I dream. Sometimes I think that's the only right thing to do.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get
author: W. P. Kinsella

quote: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: When I discover who I am, Ill be free.
author: Ralph Ellison

quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.
author: Stephen King

quote: Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Look after my heart - I've left it with you.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.
author: Ally Condie

quote: Tonight I can write the saddest lines
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: If I got rid of my demons, Id lose my angels.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being in love, which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident.
author: Shawn Slovo

quote: No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it.
author: Elizabeth Peters

quote: We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.
author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars,
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: There are darknesses in life and there are lights, and you are one of the lights, the light of all lights.
author: Bram Stoker

quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

quote: There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Some people say, Never let them see you cry. I say, if youre so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone.
author: Tina Fey

quote: I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: Every great love starts with a great story...
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind.
author: Jeffrey Eugenides

quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?
author: George Carlin

quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Clary,
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: How do you spell 'love'? - Piglet
author: A.A. Milne

quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Theyre not hideous, said Tessa.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Why were you lurking under our window?
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: We are all alone, born alone, die alone, andin spite of True Romance magazineswe shall all someday look back on our lives and see that, in spite of our company, we were alone the whole way. I do not say lonelyat least, not all the timebut essentially, and finally, alone. This is what makes your self-respect so important, and I don't see how you can respect yourself if you must look in the hearts and minds of others for your happiness.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Believe in Your Heart
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave.
author: Mo Willems

quote: It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I've got nothing to do today but smile.
author: Simon and Garfunkel

quote: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
author: J. M. Barrie

quote: Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.
author: Mae West

quote: Happiness [is] only real when shared
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I am a cage, in search of a bird.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: I'm not going to wear a red dress, she said.
author: Kristin Cashore

quote: Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.
author: Voltaire

quote: I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of ones own self.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: One can never have enough socks, said Dumbledore. Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.
author: Julian Barnes

quote: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
author: Robert Frost

quote: And then he gives me a smile that just seems so genuinely sweet with just the right touch of shyness that unexpected warmth rushes through me.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: And I thought about how many people have loved those songs. And how many people got through a lot of bad times because of those songs. And how many people enjoyed good times with those songs. And how much those songs really mean. I think it would be great to have written one of those songs. I bet if I wrote one of them, I would be very proud. I hope the people who wrote those songs are happy. I hope they feel it's enough. I really do because they've made me happy. And I'm only one person.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for.
author: John A. Shedd

quote: Maybe...you'll fall in love with me all over again.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
author: John Locke

quote: Dogs never bite me. Just humans.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from.
author: Cormac McCarthy

quote: The best moments in reading are when you come across something  a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things  which you had thought special and particular to you. Now here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out and taken yours.
author: Alan Bennett

quote: I can listen no longer in silence. I must speak to you by such means as are within my reach. You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope. Tell me not that I am too late, that such precious feelings are gone for ever. I offer myself to you again with a heart even more your own than when you almost broke it, eight years and a half ago. Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death. I have loved none but you. Unjust I may have been, weak and resentful I have been, but never inconstant. You alone have brought me to Bath. For you alone, I think and plan. Have you not seen this? Can you fail to have understood my wishes? I had not waited even these ten days, could I have read your feelings, as I think you must have penetrated mine. I can hardly write. I am every instant hearing something which overpowers me. You sink your voice, but I can distinguish the tones of that voice when they would be lost on others. Too good, too excellent creature! You do us justice, indeed. You do believe that there is true attachment and constancy among men. Believe it to be most fervent, most undeviating, in F. W.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Better to be strong than pretty and useless.
author: Lilith Saintcrow

quote: If you are a dreamer come in
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.
author: Émile Zola

quote: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
author: Mark Twain

quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Don't tell me, Jace said, Simon's turned himself into an ocelot and you want me to do something about it before Isabelle makes him into a stole. Well, you'll have have to wait till tomorrow. I'm out of commission. He pointed at himself - he was wearing blue pajamas with a hole in the sleeve. Look. Jammies.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget.
author: Robert Jordan

quote: The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on. If you can change the way people think. The way they see themselves. The way they see the world. You can change the way people live their lives. That's the only lasting thing you can create.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
author: Alice Walker

quote: Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself.
author: Deborah Reber

quote: you can, you should, and if youre brave enough to start, you will.
author: Stephen King

quote: Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-God damn it, you've got to be kind.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Don't feel bad, I'm usually about to die.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: I realize only one person will be damaged beyond repair if Peeta dies. Me.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: The real story of the Fleece: there were these two children of Zeus, Cadmus and Europa, okay? They were about to get offered up as human sacrifices, when they prayed to Zeus to save them. So Zeus sent this magical flying ram with golden wool, which picked them up in Greece and carried them all the way to Colchis in Asia Minor. Well, actually it carried Cadmus. Europa fell off and died along the way, but that's not important.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Make improvements, not excuses. Seek respect, not attention.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: That's why they call it the American Dream, because you have to be asleep to believe it.
author: George Carlin

quote: Before you, Bella, my life was like a moonless night. Very dark, but there were stars, points of light and reason. ...And then you shot across my sky like a meteor. Suddenly everything was on fire; there was brilliancy, there was beauty. When you were gone, when the meteor had fallen over the horizon, everything went black. Nothing had changed, but my eyes were blinded by the light. I couldnt see the stars anymore. And there was no more reason, for anything.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: Though she be but little, she is fierce!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: But in the end one needs more courage to live than to kill himself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Don't let the expectations and opinions of other people affect your decisions. It's your life, not theirs. Do what matters most to you; do what makes you feel alive and happy. Don't let the expectations and ideas of others limit who you are. If you let others tell you who you are, you are living their reality  not yours. There is more to life than pleasing people. There is much more to life than following others' prescribed path. There is so much more to life than what you experience right now. You need to decide who you are for yourself. Become a whole being. Adventure.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem.
author: Diana Gabaldon

quote: She read books as one would breathe air, to fill up and live.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: You will lose someone you cant live without,and your heart will be badly broken, and the bad news is that you never completely get over the loss of your beloved. But this is also the good news. They live forever in your broken heart that doesnt seal back up. And you come through. Its like having a broken leg that never heals perfectlythat still hurts when the weather gets cold, but you learn to dance with the limp.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: From the moment I picked up your book until I put it down, I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.
author: George Orwell

quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Even if you are on the right track, youll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Was it hard? I ask.
author: Lisa Schroeder

quote: He was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run. He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.
author: Harper Lee

quote: You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: Let everything happen to you
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: love the life you live.
author: Bob Marley

quote: Knock, And He'll open the door
author: Jalal Ad-Din Rumi

quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
author: Voltaire

quote: A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
author: David Byrne

quote: I nodded, looking at Rachel with respect. You hit the Lord of the Titans in the eye with a blue plastic hairbrush.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: A DEFINITION NOT FOUND
author: Markus Zusak

quote: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.
author: John Guare

quote: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families.
author: Jay McInerney

quote: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
author: A.A. Milne

quote: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.
author: Madonna

quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.
author: Noël Coward

quote: When I am with you, we stay up all night.
author: Rumi

quote: Every now and then I like to do as I'm told, just to confuse people.
author: Tamora Pierce

quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.
author: Bob Marley

quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths;
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement, There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for plannning. No time for a future. But then the life spans started getting longer, and people started having more and more future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future--you go to high school so you can go to college so you can get a good job so you can get a nice house so you can afford to send your kids to college so they can get a good job so they can get a nice house so they can afford to send their kids to college.
author: John Green

quote: What are all these? Clary asked.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.
author: Dan Brown

quote: I could not tell you if I loved you the first moment I saw you, or if it was the second or third or fourth. But I remember the first moment I looked at you walking toward me and realized that somehow the rest of the world seemed to vanish when I was with you.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Winter is coming.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: You possess other people's...bodies.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Don't be so humble - you are not that great.
author: Golda Meir

quote: What if it lines up like it did in the Trojan War ... Athena versus Poseidon?
author: Rick Riordan

quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.
author: Jay Asher

quote: Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

quote: Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.
author: José N. Harris

quote: Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence.
author: Karen Marie Moning

quote: Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
author: Jane Goodall

quote: Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time.
author: Murakami, Haruki

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Art and love are the same thing: Its the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.
author: Chuck Klosterman

quote: My imagination functions much better when I don't have to speak to people.
author: Patricia Highsmith

quote: The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or touched, they are felt with the heart.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.
author: Joshua Slocum

quote: I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold.
author: S.E. Hinton

quote: And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Acts of Kindness:
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: So when the moon's only partly full, you only feel a little wolfy?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
author: Irina Dunn

quote: You think my first instinct is to protect you. Because you're small, or a girl, or a Stiff. But you're wrong.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
author: John Muir

quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.
author: A.A. Milne

quote: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Don't bend; don't water it down; don't try to make it logical; don't edit your own soul according to the fashion. Rather, follow your most intense obsessions mercilessly.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.
author: David Levithan

quote: There is no exquisite beauty without some strangeness in the proportion.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.
author: Dan Brown

quote: Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: I knew, in the silence that followed, that anything could happen here. It might be too late: again, I might have missed my chance. But I would at least know I tried, that I took my heart and extended my hand, whatever the outcome.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Dont waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.
author: George Carlin

quote: People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss.
author: Nick Hornby

quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: Im ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I dont accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic  on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg  or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: These violent delights have violent ends
author: William Shakespeare

quote: All great and precious things are lonely.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quote: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
author: Mother Theresa

quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
author: John Lennon

quote: Keep in mind that people change, but the past doesn't.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Your friend's poetry is terrible, he said.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
author: Bette Midler

quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.
author: Isabel Allende

quote: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.
author: Jane Austen

quote: There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: Then I realize what it is. It's him. Something about him makes me feel like I am about to fall. Or turn to liquid. Or burst into flames.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),
author: e.e. cummings

quote: I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.
author: Shmuley Boteach

quote: And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: A good book is an event in my life.
author: Stendhal

quote: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.
author: Jeaniene Frost

quote: You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quote: The best thing for being sad, replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then  to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn.
author: T.H. White

quote: Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: To be, or not to be: that is the question:
author: William Shakespeare

quote: If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Love is the absence of judgment.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.
author: Veronica Roth
