The way you get meaning into your life is to devote yourself to loving others, devote yourself to your community around you, and devote yourself to creating something that gives you purpose and meaning.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
author: Pat  Monahan

quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
author: Moliere

quote: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.
author: Rumi Jalalud-Din

quote: I have nothing to declare except my genius.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.
author: Fannie Flagg

quote: When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.
author: Harper Lee

quote: Holding anger is a poison...It eats you from inside...We think that by hating someone we hurt them...But hatred is a curved blade...and the harm we do to others...we also do to ourselves.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
author: Harper Lee

quote: You could say sorry, suggested Harry bluntly.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.
author: Melissa Marr

quote: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; its all an experience.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.
author: David Henry Hwang

quote: In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art.
author: Rumi

quote: Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Atticus, he was real nice.
author: Harper Lee

quote: There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Gus: It tastes like...
author: John Green

quote: Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.
author: Jane Yolen

quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.
author: Mark Twain

quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that cant be in books.
author: Gary Paulsen

quote: Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.
author: Lauren Conrad

quote: I got schooled this year
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Whatever you are physically...male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy--all those things matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The major problem
author: Douglas Adams

quote: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The only truth is music.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.
author: Caroline Gordon

quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Your silence will not protect you.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
author: Anne Frank

quote: The past is never where you think you left it.
author: Katherine Anne Porter

quote: make a radical change in your lifestyle and begin to boldly do things which you may previously never have thought of doing, or been too hesitant to attempt. So many people live within unhappy circumstances and yet will not take the initiative to change their situation because they are conditioned to a life of security, conformity, and conservation, all of which may appear to give one peace of mind, but in reality nothing is more damaging to the adventurous spirit within a man than a secure future. The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun. If you want to get more out of life, you must lose your inclination for monotonous security and adopt a helter-skelter style of life that will at first appear to you to be crazy. But once you become accustomed to such a life you will see its full meaning and its incredible beauty.
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.
author: Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

quote: Time doesnt heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quote: Have you tried talking to her?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.
author: Washington Irving

quote: We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
author: E.E. Cummings

quote: True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.
author: Kiera Cass

quote: Um...is that thing
author: Rick Riordan

quote: If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.
author: Gayle Forman

quote: Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: We're staying together, he promised. You're not getting away from me. Never again.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.
author: Stephen Fry

quote: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: The earth laughs in flowers.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: ...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, thats like saying you can never change your fate.
author: Amy Tan

quote: I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Ive been fighting to be who I am all my life. Whats the point of being who I am, if I cant have the person who was worth all the fighting for?
author: Stephanie Lennox

quote: The things you used to own, now they own you.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Can you surf really well, then?
author: Rick Riordan

quote: You only live twice:
author: Ian Fleming

quote: If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.
author: Nicole Krauss

quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: to love life, to love it even
author: Ellen Bass

quote: Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.
author: Philip José Farmer

quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: What's up? I asked.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Even
author: Hafiz

quote: So light a fire! Harry choked. Yes...of course...but there's no wood! ...
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Well, she's not responding to my advances, he observed more brightly than he felt, so she must be dead.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You are okay? he asked. Not eaten by monsters?
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: To-morrow, and to-morrow, and to-morrow,
author: William Shakespeare

quote: You are not rich until you have a rich heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Will rolled up his sleeves. We'll probably have to knock down the door--
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.
author: Nadezhda Mandelstam

quote: When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Hope is a waking dream.
author: Aristotle

quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
author: Aristotle

quote: The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.
author: George Orwell

quote: Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light;
author: Sarah   Williams

quote: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Freedom lies in being bold.
author: Robert Frost

quote: You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.
author: Plato

quote: Demon pox, oh demon pox
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The question is not what you look at, but what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.
author: Dan Brown

quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.
author: Henry Thomas Buckle

quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.
author: John Lennon

quote: Seventeen, eh! said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.
author: Mae West

quote: Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures.
author: Tahereh Mafi

quote: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.
author: Sarah J. Maas

quote: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?
author: Julie Kagawa

quote: The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Stop fighting me! he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: Always be a poet, even in prose.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter
author: John Keats

quote: Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

quote: I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.
author: Alyson Noel

quote: The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
author: Jack London

quote: You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?
author: Mark Twain

quote: Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.
author: David Nicholls

quote: Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. I'm okay we say. I'm alright. But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.
author: Judith McNaught

quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: Never miss a good chance to shut up.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane
author: Rachel Caine

quote: Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war
author: John Green

quote: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.
author: Albert Dietrich

quote: You're something between a dream and a miracle.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: Youll get over it Its the clichs that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You dont get over it because it is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: A small but noteworthy note. I've seen so many young men over the years who think they're running at other young men. They are not. They are running at me.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: We dont need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and donts: we need books, time, and silence.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Watch out for intellect,
author: Anne Sexton

quote: Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Atticus said to Jem one day, Id rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know youll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit em, but remember its a sin to kill a mockingbird. That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. Your fathers right, she said. Mockingbirds dont do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They dont eat up peoples gardens, dont nest in corn cribs, they dont do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. Thats why its a sin to kill a mockingbird.
author: Harper Lee

quote: I'm going to keep going until I succeed  or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.
author: H.L. Mencken

quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: To survive, you must tell stories.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym.
author: Stephen King

quote: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Don't let the muggles get you down.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Well-read people are less likely to be evil.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
author: Judy Garland

quote: I can't eat and I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in terms of being a functional human, you know?
author: Ned Vizzini

quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: There are much worse games to play.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Im not in this world to live up to your expectations and youre not in this world to live up to mine.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.
author: Betty Smith

quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.
author: John Green

quote: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.
author: Roberto Bolaño

quote: A girl calls and asks, Does it hurt very much to die?
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
author: J.K.Rowling

quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I hate men who are afraid of women's strength.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

quote: A short story is a different thing altogether  a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.
author: Stephen King

quote: And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
author: Epicurus

quote: Did you really want to die?
author: Tiffanie DeBartolo

quote: If no one cares for you at all, do you even really exist?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.
author: Mae West

quote: We are always the same age inside.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of parties with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.
author: Alan Moore

quote: In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Humor is reason gone mad.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Hang on, did you just call me Angel? I asked.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Can you be a girl for a few seconds?
author: Veronica Roth

quote: You're a guardian angel now. I was still too much in awe to wrap my mind around it, but at the same time I felt amazement, curiosity...happiness.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.
author: John Muir

quote: I just want to be wonderful.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

quote: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.
author: Dean Koontz

quote: To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. No, I won't let you. Trust me, I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. On the count of three? Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. The count of three, he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. Hold them out. I want everyone to see, he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. One. Maybe I'm wrong. Two. Maybe they don't care if we both die. Three! It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: there is a place in the heart that
author: Charles bukowski

quote: All thinking men are atheists.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: But until a person can say deeply and honestly, I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday, that person cannot say, I choose otherwise.
author: Stephen R. Covey

quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.
author: Cheris Kramarae

quote: Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Moths, repeats Will. You're afraid of moths?
author: Veronica Roth

quote: I think and think and think, Ive thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!
author: Maya Angelou

quote: She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Dont wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope.
author: Barack Obama

quote: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: There is no such thing as a broken family. Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
author: Woody Allen

quote: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: I sit beside the fire and think
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Maybe this world is another planets hell.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
author: Ben Okri

quote: Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: God alert! Blackjack yelled. It's the wine dude!
author: Rick Riordan

quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I have accepted fear as part of life  specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....
author: Erica Jong

quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
author: Marie Curie

quote: This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.
author: James Lecesne

quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: My only love sprung from my only hate!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.
author: Confucius

quote: I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.
author: Brian Selznick

quote: I was always hungry for love. Just once, I wanted to know what it was like to get my fill of it -- to be fed so much love I couldn't take any more. Just once.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.
author: Ken Kesey

quote: It is not the length of life, but the depth.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: If I should have a daughterInstead of Mom, shes gonna call me Point B. Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And Im going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.
author: Sarah Kay

quote: Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

quote: People, generally, suck.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: Jace?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: But- Maia, still looking at Alec and Magnus, broke off and rasied her eyebrows. Simon turned to see what she was looking at - and stared.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: Clary felt suddenly annoyed. When the self-congratulatory part of the evening is over, maybe we could get back to saving my best friend from being exsanguinated to death?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Hello, Harry said George, beaming at him. We thought we heard your dulcet tones.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist
author: Gena Showalter

quote: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
author: Herman Melville

quote: If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: It's gonna go wrong. Or She's going to hurt me. Or,I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . . Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge.
author: China Miéville

quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Man is the cruelest animal.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand
author: Hayley Williams

quote: Sebastian just smiled. I could hear your heart beating, he said softly. When you were watching me with Valentine. Did it bother you?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: But Dumbledore says he doesn't care what they do as long as they don't take him off the Chocolate Frog cards.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.
author: Chaim Potok

quote: What else? She is so beautiful. You dont get tired of looking at her. You never worry if she is smarter than you: You know she is. She is funny without ever being mean. I love her. I am so lucky to love her, Van Houten. You dont get to choose if you get hurt in this world, old man, but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices. I hope she likes hers.
author: John Green

quote: People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived. For people like me and Echo, our souls contained more scar tissue than life.
author: Katie McGarry

quote: You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book or you take a trip and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Spring is the time of plans and projects.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I fell in love with you, smartass, because you were one of usbecause you werent afraid of me, and you decided to end your spectacular victory by throwing that piece of bone at Amarantha like a javelin. I felt Cassians spirit beside me in that moment, and could have sworn I heard him say, If you dont marry her, you stupid prick, I will.
author: Sarah J. Maas

quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
author: George Washington Burnap

quote: I figured something out. The future is unpredictable.
author: John Green

quote: In life, finding a voice is speaking and living the truth. Each of you is an original. Each of you has a distinctive voice. When you find it, your story will be told. You will be heard.
author: John Grisham

quote: It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: I didnt go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly dont recommend Christianity.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: How long was I asleep? she whispered. He didn't respond.
author: Sarah J. Maas

quote: I don't care, Clary said. He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: You think the dead we loved truly ever leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Is man merely a mistake of God's? Or God merely a mistake of man?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Silence is so freaking loud
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
author: George Washington

quote: It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.
author: George Orwell

quote: There must be something in books, something we cant imagine, to make a woman stay in a burning house; there must be something there. You dont stay for nothing.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Lord, what fools these mortals be!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?
author: John Keats

quote: God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of His own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players [i.e. everybody], to being involved in an obscure and complex variant of poker in a pitch-dark room, with blank cards, for infinite stakes, with a Dealer who won't tell you the rules, and who
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Scars have the strange power to remind us that our past is real.
author: Cormac McCarthy

quote: We learn from failure, not from success!
author: Bram Stoker

quote: Poetry is what gets lost in translation.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The heart is an arrow. It demands aim to land true.
author: Leigh Bardugo

quote: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: You know it's never fifty-fifty in a marriage. It's always seventy-thirty, or sixty-forty. Someone falls in love first. Someone puts someone else up on a pedestal. Someone works very hard to keep things rolling smoothly; someone else sails along for the ride.
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: There's nothing worse than waiting and not knowing what'll happen to you. Your own imagination can be crueler than any captor.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: To hurt is as human as to breathe.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I pray because I can't help myself. I pray because I'm helpless. I pray because the need flows out of me all the time- waking and sleeping. It doesn't change God- it changes me.
author: William Nicholson

quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: if you love two people at the same time, choose the second. Because if you really loved the first one, you wouldn't have fallen for the second.
author: Johnny Depp

quote: The bird, the pin, the song, the berries, the watch, the cracker, the dress that burst into flames. I am the mockingjay. The one that survived despite the Capitol's plans. The symbol of the rebellion.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Do no harm and leave the world a better place than you found it.
author: Patricia Cornwell

quote: Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it.
author: John Anster

quote: The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Marriage can wait, education cannot.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The difference between sex and love is that sex relieves tension and love causes it.
author: Woody Allen

quote: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Tolstoy Leo

quote: Accio Brain!
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.
author: Aristotle

quote: It's so strange how life works: You want something and you wait and wait and feel like it's taking forever to come. Then it happens and it's over and all you want to do is curl back up in that moment before things changed.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: Laugh, even when you feel too sick or too worn out or tired.
author: Alysha Speer

quote: Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.
author: Albert Camus

quote: All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
author: Nora Roberts

quote: Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Instructions for living a life.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Mental pain is less dramatic than physical pain, but it is more common and also more hard to bear. The frequent attempt to conceal mental pain increases the burden: it is easier to say My tooth is aching than to say My heart is broken.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Black hair and blue eyes are my favorite combination.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
author: C.G. Jung

quote: It's the mortal cup Jace, not the mortal toilet bowl.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!
author: Mark A. Cooper

quote: My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness.
author: André Breton

quote: Dress shabbily and they remember the dress; dress impeccably and they remember the woman.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time.
author: Robin Williams

quote: The world was collapsing, and the only thing that really mattered to me was that she was alive.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Today is the sort of day where the sun only comes up to humiliate you.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: If all the world hated you and believed you wicked, while your own conscience approved of you and absolved you from guilt, you would not be without friends.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: I just want you to know that youre very special and the only reason Im telling you is that I dont know if anyone else ever has.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.
author: Gilles Deleuze

quote: Never marry at all, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired, women, because they are curious: both are disappointed.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: It is often in the darkest
author: Richard Evans

quote: Demons run when a good man goes to war
author: Steven Moffat

quote: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.
author: Lewis Caroll

quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.
author: anthony burgess

quote: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I am a part of all that I have met.
author: Alfred Tennyson

quote: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Yes, we praise women over 40 for a multitude of reasons. Unfortunately, it's not reciprocal. For every stunning, smart, well-coiffed, hot woman over 40, there is a bald, paunchy relic in yellow pants making a fool of himself with some 22-year old waitress. Ladies, I apologize. For all those men who say, Why buy the cow when you can get the milk for free?, here's an update for you. Nowadays 80% of women are against marriage. Why? Because women realize it's not worth buying an entire pig just to get a little sausage!
author: Frank Kaiser

quote: There is a pleasure in the pathless woods,
author: Lord Byron

quote: I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: Go down again - I dwell among the people.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?
author: Albert Einstein

quote: livid,
author: David Levithan

quote: Be awesome! Be a book nut!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
author: Voltaire

quote: If you love something set it free, but don't be surprised if it comes back with herpes.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: The past beats inside me like a second heart.
author: John Banville

quote: Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.
author: John Updike

quote: Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: One must live as if it would be forever, and as if one might die each moment. Always both at once.
author: Mary Renault

quote: The present changes the past. Looking back you do not find what you left behind.
author: Kiran Desai

quote: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!
author: Adolf Hitler

quote: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?
author: George Carlin

quote: The Voice
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: No matter how plain a woman may be, if truth and honesty are written across her face, she will be beautiful.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: In the end that was the choice you made, and it doesn't matter how hard it was to make it. It matters that you did.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace.
author: John Lennon

quote: Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: Stepping onto a brand-new path is difficult, but not more difficult than remaining in a situation, which is not nurturing to the whole woman.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have Faith.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: You don't love a girl because of beauty. You love her because she sings a song only you can understand.
author: L.J. Smith

quote: Listen to them, the children of the night. What music they make!
author: Bram Stoker

quote: After all, Ginger Rogers did everything that Fred Astaire did. She just did it backwards and in high heels.
author: Ann Richards

quote: Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: You know, some people think Shadowhunters are just myths. Like mummies and genies. Kyle grinned at Jace. Can you grant wishes?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
author: George Carlin

quote: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
author: Robert Frost

quote: It matters not how strait the gate,
author: William Ernest Henley

quote: There's no need to clarify my finger snap, said Magnus. The implication was clear in the snap itself.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind.
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What you are being taught here is an amalgam of current prejudice and the choices of this particular culture. The slightest look at history will show how impermanent these must be. You are being taught by people who have been able to accommodate themselves to a regime of thought laid down by their predecessors. It is a self-perpetuating system. Those of you who are more robust and individual than others will be encouraged to leave and find ways of educating yourself  educating your own judgements. Those that stay must remember, always, and all the time, that they are being moulded and patterned to fit into the narrow and particular needs of this particular society.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: You can't lie to your soul.
author: Irvine Welsh

quote: Like all magnificent things, it's very simple.
author: Natalie Babbitt

quote: Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Books: a beautifully browsable invention that needs no electricity and exists in a readable form no matter what happens.
author: Nicholson Baker

quote: I am awfully greedy; I want everything from life. I want to be a woman and to be a man, to have many friends and to have loneliness, to work much and write good books, to travel and enjoy myself, to be selfish and to be unselfish You see, it is difficult to get all which I want. And then when I do not succeed I get mad with anger.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: It's like learning to ride a unicorn. You never forget.
author: Eoin Colfer

quote: Coach: All right, Patch. let's say you're at a party. the room is full of girls of all shapes and sizes. You see blondes, brunettes, redheads, a few girl with black hair. Some are talkive, while other appear shy. You've one girl who fits your profile - attractive, intelligent and vulnerable. Dow do you let her know you're interested?
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.
author: Kiera Cass

quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

quote: Youll get over it Its the clichs that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You dont get over it because it is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: Watch out for intellect,
author: Anne Sexton

quote: The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I was always hungry for love. Just once, I wanted to know what it was like to get my fill of it -- to be fed so much love I couldn't take any more. Just once.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
author: Anais Nin

quote: You know it's never fifty-fifty in a marriage. It's always seventy-thirty, or sixty-forty. Someone falls in love first. Someone puts someone else up on a pedestal. Someone works very hard to keep things rolling smoothly; someone else sails along for the ride.
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness.
author: André Breton

quote: The world was collapsing, and the only thing that really mattered to me was that she was alive.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: If you love something set it free, but don't be surprised if it comes back with herpes.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: livid,
author: David Levithan

quote: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: I won't ever leave you, even though you're always leaving me.
author: Audrey Niffenegger

quote: sometimes you don't need a goal in life, you don't need to know the big picture. you just need to know what you're going to do next!
author: Sophie Kinsella

quote: I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: The only calibration that counts is how much heart people invest, how much they ignore their fears of being hurt or caught out or humiliated. And the only thing people regret is that they didn't live boldly enough, that they didn't invest enough heart, didn't love enough. Nothing else really counts at all.
author: Ted Hughes

quote: In the moment when I truly understand my enemy, understand him well enough to defeat him, then in that very moment I also love him. I think its impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves. And then, in that very moment when I love them.... I destroy them.
author: Orson Scott Card

quote: The bond forged between us was not one that could be broken by absence, distance, or time. And no matter how much more special or beautiful or brilliant or perfect than me he might be, he was as irreversibly altered as I was. As I would always belong to him, so would he always be mine.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: Love is . . . Being happy for the other person when they are happy, Being sad for the person when they are sad, Being together in good times, And being together in bad times.
author: Susan Polis Schutz

quote: sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: I want to be the friend you fall hopelessly in love with. The one you take into your arms and into your bed and into the private world you keep trapped in your head. I want to be that kind of friend. The one who will memorize the things you say as well as the shape of your lips when you say them. I want to know every curve, every freckle, every shiver of your body.
author: Tahereh Mafi

quote: I'm about to make a wild, extreme and severe relationship rule: the word busy is a load of crap and is most often used by assholes. The word busy is the relationship Weapon of Mass Destruction. It seems like a good excuse, but in fact in every silo you uncover, all you're going to find is a man who didn't care enough to call. Remember men are never to busy to get what they want.
author: Greg Behrendt

quote: For my part, I prefer my heart to be broken. It is so lovely, dawn-kaleidoscopic within the crack.
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: Go down again - I dwell among the people.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze.
author: Elinor Glyn

quote: In a perfect world, you could fuck people without giving them a piece of your heart. And every glittering kiss and every touch of flesh is another shard of heart youll never see again.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: About all you can do in life is be who you are. Some people will love you for you. Most will love you for what you can do for them, and some won't like you at all.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day.
author: Emily Brontë

quote: We are not trapped or locked up in these bones. No, no. We are free to change. And love changes us. And if we can love one another, we can break open the sky.
author: Walter Mosley

quote: Someday you're gonna look back on this moment of your life as such a sweet time of grieving. You'll see that you were in mourning and your heart was broken, but your life was changing...
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: For where all love is, the speaking is unnecessary
author: Diana Gabaldon

quote: Ok. You fuck me, then snub me. You love me, you hate me. You show me a sensitive side, then you turn into a total asshole. Is this a pretty accurate description of our relationship.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: The soul is healed by being with children.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: You have to kiss a lot of frogs before you find your prince
author: E.L. James

quote: Sometimes when I'm alone, I take the pearl from where it lives in my pocket and try to remember the boy with the bread, the strong arms that warded off nightmares on the train, the kisses in the arena.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: We are who we are, because of those we choose to love and because of those who love us.
author: Kate Mosse

quote: When we meet someone and fall in love, we have a sense that the whole universe is on our side. And yet if something goes wrong, there is nothing left! How is it possible for the beauty that was there only minutes before to vanish so quickly? Life moves very fast. It rushes from heaven to hell in a matter of seconds.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: If there is no love in the world, we will make a new world, and we will give it walls, and we will furnish it with soft, red interiors, from the inside out, and give it a knocker that resonates like a diamond falling to a jeweller's felt so that we should never hear it. Love me, because love doesn't exist, and I have tried everything that does.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: When I look in the mirror, I know Im looking at someone who isnt sure she deserves to be loved at all.
