Bubbles that will blur the rest of the world to them, make them feel like that is it, that they've reached the end. Sometimes, even the really smart kids, make stupid decisions. They lose control. Parents need to realize that the world is getting complicated every second of every day. With new problems, new diseases, new habits. They have to realize the vast probability of their kids being victims of this age, this complicated era. Your kids could be exposed to problems that no kind of therapy can help. Your kids could be brainwashed by themselves to believe in insane theories that drive them crazy. Most kids will go through this stage. The lucky ones will understand. They will grow out of them. The unlucky ones will live in these problems. Grow in them and never move forward. They will cut themselves, overdose on drugs, take up excessive drinking and smoking, for the slightest problems in their lives.
author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi

quote: Can't you ever be serious?' I said, mortified.
author: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni

quote: Even without wars, life is dangerous.
author: Anne Sexton

quote: Life is just too much for me. I've been confused right from the day I was born... I think the whole trouble is that we're thrown into life too fast... We're not really prepared...
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: ...In books there's always somebody standing by ready to say
author: Lev Grossman

quote: Mahoney: Thirty-seven seconds. Great, well done; now we wait.
author: Suzanne Weyn

quote: I get it now; I didn't get it then. That life is about losing and about doing it as gracefully as possible...and enjoying everything in between.
author: Mia Farrow

quote: He had come to that moment in his age when there occurred to him, with increasing intensity, a question of such overwhelming simplicity that he had no means to face it. He found himself wondering if his life were worth the living; if it had ever been. It was a question, he suspected, that came to all men at one time or another; he wondered if it came to them with such impersonal force as it came to him. The question brought with it a sadness, but it was a general sadness which (he thought) had little to do with himself or with his particular fate; he was not even sure that the question sprang from the most immediate and obvious causes, from what his own life had become. It came, he believed, from the accretion of his years, from the density of accident and circumstance, and from what he had come to understand of them. He took a grim and ironic pleasure from the possibility that what little learning he had managed to acquire had led him to this knowledge: that in the long run all things, even the learning that let him know this, were futile and empty, and at last diminished into a nothingness they did not alter.
author: John  Williams

quote: I'm dying and all I hear are insults!
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: He'd always been a man who followed his head and not his heart.The heart was just a bloody motor.The head was meant to drive
author: Mario Puzo

quote: Life rises out of death, death rises out of life; in being opposite they yearn to each other, they give birth to each other and are forever reborn. And with them, all is reborn, the flower of the apple tree, the light of the stars. In life is death. In death is rebirth. What then is life without death? Life unchanging, everlasting, eternal?-What is it but death-death without rebirth?
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: But a kingdom that has once been destroyed can never come again into being; nor can the dead ever be brought back to life.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: But certainly, for us who understand life, figures are a matter of indifference.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: The hemulen woke up slowly and recognised himself and wished he had been someone he didn't know.
author: Tove Jansson

quote: Mr. Smith yelled at the doctor,
author: Tim Burton

quote: Love changes what is probable and makes unlikely things possible.
author: Ally Condie

quote: Would you like to know your future?
author: Vera Nazarian

quote: Love doesn't make the world go 'round; love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
author: Shannon Alder

quote: Do you know why books such as this are so important? Because they have quality. And what does the word quality mean? To me it means texture. This book has pores. It has features. This book can go under the microscope. Youd find life under the glass, streaming past in infinite profusion. The more pores, the more truthfully recorded details of life per square inch you can get on a sheet of paper, the more literary you are. Thats my definition anyway. Telling detail. Fresh detail. The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies. So now you see why books are hated and feared? They show the pores in the face of life.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: All successful people men and women are big dreamers. They imagine what their future could be, ideal in every respect, and then they work every day toward their distant vision, that goal or purpose.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: I believe life is constantly testing us for our level of commitment, and life's
author: Anthony Robbins

quote: This autumn-
author: Basho Matsuo

quote: Stop comparing yourself to others. Always strive to improve yourself to become better today than you were yesterday to serve those around you and the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: It is astounding to me, and achingly sad, that with eighty thousand people on the waiting list for donated hearts and livers and kidneys, with sixteen a day dying there on that list, that more then half of the people in the position H's family was in will say no, will choose to burn those organs or let them rot. We abide the surgeon's scalpel to save our own lives, out loved ones' lives, but not to save a stranger's life. H has no heart, but heartless is the last thing you'd call her.
author: Mary Roach

quote: Despair is the price one pays for setting oneself an impossible aim. It is, one is told, the unforgivable sin, but it is a sin the corrupt or evil man never practices. He always has hope. He never reaches the freezing-point of knowing absolute failure. Only the man of goodwill carries always in his heart this capacity for damnation.
author: Graham Greene

quote: Each player must accept the cards life deals him or her; but once they are in hand, he or she alone must decide how to play the cards in order to win the game.
author: Voltaire

quote: There are only a few notes. Just variations on a theme.
author: John Lennon

quote: Whenever I see an ambulance, I like to think there is a baby being born, rather than a death.
author: Phil Lester

quote: Life may not be pretty but it's always beautiful. We may only see the ugliness on the surface. The shit that only the world chooses to notice. But, if we dig deep, if we get to the heart of life, where there's no pain or fear, where we can just be who we are and love freely without judgement, it's really beautiful.
author: S.L. Jennings

quote: Even if no salvation should come, I want to be worthy of it at every moment.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: In the year 2025, the best men don't run for president, they run for their lives. . . .
author: Stephen King

quote: Every single desire can lead to dream and every single dream has possibility to become reality.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: I know I'm an acquired taste - I'm anchovies. And not everybody wants those hairy little things.
author: Tori Amos

quote: Still, he figured, sometimes you've got to do what you've got to do, and then sometimes you've just got to run like hell after it's done.
author: Derek Landy

quote: Music is enough for a lifetime, but a lifetime is not enough for music.
author: Sergei Rachmaninov

quote: Cake is happiness! If you know the way of the cake, you know the way of happiness! If you have a cake in front of you, you should not look any further for joy!
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Life is a slope. As long as you're going up you're always looking towards the top and you feel happy, but when you reach it, suddenly you can see the road going downhill and death at the end of it all. It's slow going up and quick going down.
author: Guy de Maupassant

quote: But there must be some pleasure in condemning everything--in perceiving faults where others think they see beauties.'
author: Voltaire

quote: You must decide if you are going to rob the world or bless it with the rich, valuable, potent, untapped resources locked away within you.
author: Myles Munroe

quote: It had always seemed to him a very plush kind of problem, a privilege, really, to consider whether life was meaningful or not.
author: Hanya Yanagihara

quote: Heaven is an idea constructed by man to help him cope with the fact that life on earth is both brutally short and, paradoxically, far too long.
author: Andrew Davidson

quote: Read deeply. Stay open. Continue to wonder.
author: Austin Kleon

quote: life's kind of like a painting. A really bizarre, abstract painting. You could look at it and think that all it is, is a blur. And you could continue living your life thinking that all it is, is just a blur. But if you really look at it, really see it, focus on it, and use your imagination, life can become so much more. The painting could be of the sea, the sky, people,buildings, a butterfly on a flower, or anything except the blur you were once convinced it was.
author: Cecelia Ahern

quote: Humanity does not suffer from the disease of wrong beliefs but humanity suffers from the contagious nature of the lack of belief. If you have no magic with you it is not because magic does not exist but it is because you do not believe in it. Even if the sun shines brightly upon your skin every day, if you do not believe in the sunlight, the sunlight for you does not exist.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: You know what's truly weird about any financial crisis? We made it up. Currency, money, finance, they're all social inventions. When the sun comes up in the morning it's shining on the same physical landscape, all the atoms are in place.
author: Bruce Sterling

quote: In books I have traveled, not only to other worlds, but into my own. I learned who I was and who I wanted to be, what I might aspire to, and what I might dare to dream about my world and myself. More powerfully and persuasively than from the shalt nots of the Ten Commandments, I learned the difference between good and evil, right and wrong. A Wrinkle in Time described that evil, that wrong, existing in a different dimension from our own. But I felt that I, too, existed much of the time in a different dimension from everyone else I knew. There was waking, and there was sleeping. And then there were books, a kind of parallel universe in which anything might happen and frequently did, a universe in which I might be a newcomer but was never really a stranger. My real, true world. My perfect island.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: I hate when people say 'I see'. It doesn't mean anything and I think it's hostile. Whenever anyone tells me 'I see' I think they're really saying 'Fuck you'.
author: Peter Cameron

quote: When someone tells you theyve just bought a house, they might as well tell you they no longer have a personality. You can immediately assume so many things: that theyre locked into jobs they hate; that theyre broke; that they spend every night watching videos; that theyre fifteen pounds overweight; that they no longer listen to new ideas. Its profoundly depressing.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: Focus on making choices to lead your life that aligns with your core values in the most purposeful way possible.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: We never know when our last day on earth will be. So, love with full sincerity, believe with true faith, and hope with all of your might. Better to have lived in truth and discovered life, than to have lived half heartedly and died long before you ever ceased breathing.
author: Cristina Marrero

quote: No matter how many people believe or dont believe in you, you must be
author: pablo

quote: I feel very adventurous. There are so many doors to be opened, and I'm not afraid to look behind them.
author: Elizabeth  Taylor

quote: Love those who hurt you the most, because they are probably the ones closest to you.
author: Nikki Sixx

quote: To build up a library is to create a life. It's never just a random collection of books.
author: Carlos María Domínguez

quote: In the end things must be as they are and have always been--the great things remain for the great, the abysses for the profound, the delicacies and thrills for the refined, and, to sum up shortly, everything rare for the rare.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: I'm a fountain of blood. In the shape of a girl.
author: Björk

quote: We must laugh and cry, enjoy and suffer, in a word, vibrate to our full capacity  I think thats what being really human means.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Its a secondhand world were born into. What is novel to us is only so because were newborn, and what we cannot see, that has come before- what our parents have seen and been and done- are the hand-me-downs we begin to wear as swaddling clothes, even as we ourselves are naked. The flaw runs through us, implicating us in its imperfection even as it separates us, delivers us onto opposite sides of a chasm. It is both terribly beautiful and terribly sad, but it is, finally, the fault in the universe that gives birth to us all.
author: Katherine Min

quote: I think people would live a bit longer if they didn't know how old they were. Age puts restrictions on things.
author: Karl Pilkington

quote: Dont tell thin women to eat a cheeseburger. Dont tell fat women to put down the fork. Dont tell underweight men to bulk up. Dont tell women with facial hair to wax, dont tell uncircumcised men theyre gross, dont tell muscular women to go easy on the dead-lift, dont tell dark-skinned women to bleach their vagina, dont tell black women to relax their hair, dont tell flat-chested women to get breast implants, dont tell apple-shaped women whats flattering, dont tell mothers to hide their stretch marks, and dont tell people whose toes you dont approve of not to wear flip-flops. And so on, etc, etc, in every iteration until the mountains crumble to the sea. Basically, just go ahead and CEASE telling other human beings what they should and shouldn't do with their bodies unless a) you are their doctor, or b) SOMEBODY GODDAMN ASKED YOU.
author: Lindy West

quote: I look at the Augusteum,and I think that perhaps my life has not actually been so chaotic, after all. It is merely this world that is chaotic, bringing changes to us all that nobody could have anticipated. The Augusteum warns me to not to get attached to any obsolete ideas about who I am, what I represent, whom I belong to, or what function I may once have intended to serve. Yesterday I might have been a glorious monument to somebody, true enough--but tomorrow I could be a fireworks depository. Even in the Eternal City, says the silent Augusteum, one must always be prepared for riotous and endless waves of transformation.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: ...happiness does not consist in amusement. In fact, it would be strange if our end were amusement, and if we were to labor and suffer hardships all our life long merely to amuse ourselves.... The happy life is regarded as a life in conformity with virtue. It is a life which involves effort and is not spent in amusement....
author: Aristotle

quote: Your nightmares follow you like a shadow, forever.
author: Aleksandar Hemon

quote: We may run, walk, stumble. drive, or fly, but let us never lose sight of the reason for the journey, or miss a chance to see a rainbow on the way.
author: Gloria Gaither

quote: Mankind flung its advance agents ever outward, ever outward. Eventually it flung them out into space, into the colorless, tasteless, weightless sea of outwardness without end.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Children and dogs are the messengers of God some of us do not deserve them
author: Ginnetta Correli

quote: At such times the universe gets a little closer to us. They are strange times, times of beginnings and endings. Dangerous and powerful. And we feel it even if we don't know what it is. These times are not necessarily good, and not necessarily bad. In fact, what they are depends on what *we* are.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Do I have an original thought in my head? My bald head. Maybe if I were happier, my hair wouldn't be falling out.
author: Charlie Kaufman

quote: Someone once said that death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside of us while we live. I could tell you who said it, but who the hell really cares.
author: One tree hill haley james scott

quote: I don't think the world is the way we like to think it is. I don't think it's one solid world, but many, thousands upon thousands of them--as many as there are people--because each person perceives the world in his or her own way; each lives in his or her own world. Sometimes they connect, for a moment, or more rarely, for a lifetime, but mostly we are alone, each living in our own world, suffering our small deaths.
author: Charles de Lint

quote: Good morning, said the little prince.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Who lives longer? The man who takes heroin for two years and dies, or a man who lives on roast beef, water and potatoes 'till 95? One passes his 24 months in eternity. All the years of the beefeater are lived only in time.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: I've screwed everything up royally. I remember you saying that growing up happens when you start having things you look back on and wish you could change.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: ...Its hard to watch
author: Andrea Gibson

quote: Attack life, it's going to kill you anyway.
author: Steven Colbert

quote: I like to believe that you don't need to reach a certain goal to be happy. I prefer to think that happiness is always there, and that when things don't go the way we might like them to, it's a sign from above that something even better is right around the corner.
author: David Archuleta

quote: Never let fear hold you captive.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Goals are the road maps that guide you to your destination.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: There are times when a feeling of expectancy comes to me, as if something is there, beneath the surface of my understanding, waiting for me to grasp it. It is the same tantalizing sensation when you almost remember a name, but don't quite reach it. I can feel it when I think of human beings, of the hints of evolution suggested by the removal of wisdom teeth, the narrowing of the jaw no longer needed to chew such roughage as it was accustomed to; the gradual disappearance of hair from the human body; the adjustment of the human eye to the fine print, the swift, colored motion of the twentieth century. The feeling comes, vague and nebulous, when I consider the prolonged adolesence of our species; the rites of birth, marriage and death; all the primitive, barbaric ceremonies streamlined to modern times. Almost, I think, the unreasoning, bestial purity was best. Oh, something is there, waiting for me. Perhaps someday the revelation will burst in upon me and I will see the other side of this monumental grotesque joke. And then I'll laugh. And then I'll know what life is.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Ill never second guess the things that I have done. Ive got too much left to say and too much to become.
author: Alex Gaskarth

quote: Destiny is a lie. Destiny is justification for atrocity. It is the means by which murderers armour themselves against reprimand. It is a word intended to stand in place of ethics, denying all moral context.
author: Steven Erikson

quote: The dead do not hurt you; only the living do.
author: Tess Gerritsen

quote: The more you seek security, the less of it you have. But the more you seek
author: Brian Tracy

quote: There're things we keep hidden from one another. Things we hide from ourselves. Things that are kept hidden from us. And things no one knows. You always learn the damnedest things at the worst possible times.
author: Jim Butcher

quote: There are some places in life where you can only go alone. Embrace the beauty of your solo journey.
author: Mandy Hale

quote: Regret is counterproductive. It's looking back on a past that you can't change. Questioning things as they occur can prevent regret in the future.
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: Its very simple. As you grow, you learn more. If you stayed at twenty-two, youd always be as ignorant as you were at twenty-two. Aging is not just decay, you know. Its growth. Its more than the negative that youre going to die, its also the positive that you understand youre going to die, and that you live a better life because of it.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: That is life... to begin again when everything is lost!
author: A. J. Cronin

quote: The strong-minded rise to the challenge of their goals and dreams. The weak-minded become haters.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Life is but a memory Happened long ago. Theatre full of sadness For a long forgotten show.
author: Nick  Drake

quote: Some of us weren't born for rewards, Froi. We were born for sacrifices.
author: Melina Marchetta

quote: War had bled color from everything, leaving nothing but a storm of gray.
author: Ruta Sepetys

quote: Dispassionately, reasonably, he contemplated the failure that his life must appear to be. He had wanted friendship and the closeness of friendship that might hold him in the race of mankind; he had had two friends, one of whom had died senselessly before he was known, the other of whom had now withdrawn so distantly into the ranks of the living that...
author: John  Williams

quote: It strikes me profoundly that the world is more often than not a bad and cruel place.
author: Bret Easton Ellis

quote: You make mistakes, mistakes don't make you
author: Maxwell Maltz

quote: After listening and getting to know more about you. Also, feeling a deep connection between us that goes beyond physical attraction. I'm beginning to feel for, so much more than the friendship that I waited to grow with you. I'm not going to try and rush things. However, I don't want to wait until it's to late.
author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett

quote: My father chose my name , and my last name was chosen by my ancestors . Thats enough, I myself choose my way
author: Ali Shariati

quote: The past is a place of learning, not a place of living.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: You can con God and get away with it, Granny said, if you do so with charm and wit. If you live your life with imagination and verve, God will play along just to see what outrageously entertaining thing you'll do next.
author: Dean Koontz

quote: Nothing is more natural than mutual misunderstanding; the contrary is always surprising. I believe that one never agrees on anything except by mistake, and that all harmony among human beings is the happy fruit of an error.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Brother, Im not depressed and havent lost spirit. Life everywhere is life, life is in ourselves and not in the external. There will be people near me, and to be a human being among human beings, and remain one forever, no matter what misfortunes befall, not to become depressed, and not to falter  this is what life is, herein lies its task.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: No one survives life.
author: Sarah Kane

quote: ...because people who talk about their dreams are actually trying to tell you things about themselves they'd never admit in normal conversation. It's a way for people to be honest without telling the truth.
author: Chuck Klosterman

quote: The moment she was cursed, I lost her. Once it wears off- soon- she will be embarrassed to remember things that she said, things she did, things like this. No matter how solid she feels in my arms, she is made of smoke.
author: Holly Black

quote: try to enjoy myself when I can - I'll be miserable enough as it is.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Find a purpose to serve, not a lifestyle to live.
author: Criss Jami

quote: Great goals make great people. People cannot hit what they do not aim for.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: People leave imprints on our lives, shaping who we become in much the same way that a symbol is pressed into the page of a book to tell you who it comes from. Dogs, however, leave paw prints on our lives and our souls, which are as unique as fingerprints in every way.
author: Ashly Lorenzana

quote: If you would create something,
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Maybe if I forgot things once in a while, we'd all be a little bit happier.
author: Jay Asher

quote: If you wish to achieve worthwhile things in your personal and career life, you must become a worthwhile person in your own self-development.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: Life isnt meant to be lived perfectlybut merely to be LIVED. Boldly, wildly, beautifully, uncertainly, imperfectly, magically LIVED.
author: Mandy Hale

quote: ...When you die, the energy that kept you alive filters into the people you loved. Did you know that? It's like a fire you've tended all your life, and the sparks are all scattered into the wind.... That's why we survive as long as we do, because the people who loved us keep us going.
author: Kevin Brockmeier

quote: Dead, we are revealed in our true dimensions, and they are surprisingly modest.
author: Michael Cunningham

quote: In life, more than in anything else, it isnt easy to end up alive.
author: Roman Payne

quote: She thought about her life and how lost shed felt for most of it. She thought about the way that all truths shed been taught to consider valuable invariably conflicted with the world as it was actually lived. How could a person be so utterly lost, yet remain living?
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: Killers aren't always assassins. Sometimes, they don't even have blood on their hands.
author: Ruta Sepetys

quote: We have become, by the power of a glorious evolutionary accident called intelligence, the stewards of life's continuity on earth. We did not ask for this role, but we cannot abjure it. We may not be suited to it, but here we are.
author: Stephen Jay Gould

quote: Life is fair. We all get the same nine-month shake in the box, and then the dice roll. Some people get a run of sevens. Some people, unfortunately, get snake-eyes. Its just how the world is.
author: Stephen King

quote: Learn to drive?
author: Diana Wynne Jones

quote: Ships that pass in the night, and speak each other in passing,
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Has it ever struck you that life is all memory, except for the one present moment that goes by you so quick you hardly catch it going?
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: In high seas or in low seas,
author: Bob Marley

quote: It was a once in a lifetime thing. I hate to think it but I bet it's true. It's too bad for us that our once in a lifetime happened when were too young to handle it.
author: Scott Spencer

quote: Remember that life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away!
author: Vicki Corona

quote: I look back to where my life had been. It's always risky to think of letting go. That's why this is the perfect ending. Nothing left to reconcile.
author: Loretta Ellsworth

quote: Nothing ever becomes real till experienced  even a proverb is no proverb until your life has illustrated it
author: John Keats

quote: Dustfinger inspected his reddened fingers and felt the taut skin. He might tell me how my story ends, he murmured.
author: Cornelia Funke

quote: Sometimes, love brings you together even as life keeps you apart.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: All the lives I could live, all the people I will never know, never will be, they are everywhere. That is all that the world is.
author: Aleksandar Hemon

quote: Stop waiting for the perfect day or the perfect moment... Take THIS day, THIS moment and lead it to perfection.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Life is better than death, I believe, if only because it is less boring, and because it has fresh peaches in it.
author: Alice Walker

quote: Human beings have neither kindness, nor faith, nor charity beyond what serves to increase the pleasure of the moment.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Our knowledge of life is limited to death
author: Enrich Maria Remarque

quote: I had a dream about you. You were lost in a daydream, when I walked in and you began screaming. But I know that could never actually happen. In real life I only enter peoples nightmares.
author: Bauvard

quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.
author: Mae West

quote: Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
author: Woody Allen

quote: If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: People, generally, suck.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: But- Maia, still looking at Alec and Magnus, broke off and rasied her eyebrows. Simon turned to see what she was looking at - and stared.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Sebastian just smiled. I could hear your heart beating, he said softly. When you were watching me with Valentine. Did it bother you?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I figured something out. The future is unpredictable.
author: John Green

quote: God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of His own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players [i.e. everybody], to being involved in an obscure and complex variant of poker in a pitch-dark room, with blank cards, for infinite stakes, with a Dealer who won't tell you the rules, and who
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time.
author: Robin Williams

quote: If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: If you love something set it free, but don't be surprised if it comes back with herpes.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?
author: George Carlin

quote: There's no need to clarify my finger snap, said Magnus. The implication was clear in the snap itself.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: It's like learning to ride a unicorn. You never forget.
author: Eoin Colfer

quote: Where is Wood? said Harry, suddenly realizing he wasn't there.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure.
author: Mae West

quote: He cleared his throat and held up one hand dramatically.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: I know all those words, but that sentence makes no sense to me.
author: Matt Groening

quote: Rachel: You're a half-blood, too?
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Puns are the highest form of literature.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: It takes a lot of time to be a genius. You have to sit around so much, doing nothing, really doing nothing.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence; then success is sure.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Some people see things that are and ask, Why?
author: George Carlin

quote: Do you ever think if people heard our conversations they'd lock us up?
author: Wendy Mass

quote: Write what you know. That should leave you with a lot of free time.
author: Howard Nemerov

quote: Sometimes you remind me a lot of James. He called it my 'furry little problem' in company. Many people were under the impression that I owned a badly behaved rabbit.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the chemist's, but that's just peanuts to space.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning do to do afterward.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Meow means woof in cat.
author: George Carlin

quote: As long as there was coffee in the world, how bad could things be?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I like men who have a future and women who have a past.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
author: H.L. Mencken

quote: It may help to understand human affairs to be clear that most of the great triumphs and tragedies of history are caused, not by people being fundamentally good or fundamentally bad, but by people being fundamentally people.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: To lose one parent, Mr. Worthing, may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Men are from Earth, women are from Earth. Deal with it.
author: George Carlin

quote: Are you always a smartass?'
author: Jim Butcher

quote: The world is a stage and the play is badly cast.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Opera is when a guy gets stabbed in the back and, instead of bleeding, he sings.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: As long as we don't die, this is gonna be one hell of a story.
author: John Green

quote: There is nothing like puking with somebody to make you into old friends.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: If an optimist had his left arm chewed off by an alligator, he might say in a pleasant and hopeful voice, Well this isn't too bad, I don't have a left arm anymore but at least nobody will ever ask me if I'm left-handed or right-handed, but most of us would say something more along the lines of, Aaaaaa! My arm! My arm!
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: To you, I'm an atheist.
author: Woody Allen

quote: People say, 'I'm going to sleep now,' as if it were nothing. But it's really a bizarre activity. 'For the next several hours, while the sun is gone, I'm going to become unconscious, temporarily losing command over everything I know and understand. When the sun returns, I will resume my life.'
author: George Carlin

quote: You live but once; you might as well be amusing.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: It seemed weird calling a teenager 'sir' but I'd learned to be careful with immortals. They tended to get offended easily. Then, they blew stuff up.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: I have a high pain threshold. In fact, it's more of a large and tastfully decorated foyer than a threshold. But I do get easily bored
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: People have an annoying habit of remembering things they shouldn't.
author: Christopher Paolini

quote: Technically, I am unarmed. But no one should ever underestimate the harm that fingernails can do. Especially if the target is unprepared.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: French name, English accent, American school. Anna confused.
author: Stephanie Perkins

quote: Its fascinating. You know all these words, and theyre all English, but when you string them together into sentences, they just dont make any sense.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: have i gone mad?
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: I told Augustus the broad outline of my miracle: diagnosed with Stage IV thyroid cancer when I was thirteen. (I didnt tell him that the diagnosis came three months after I got my first period. Like: Congratulations! Youre a woman. Now die.)
author: John Green

quote: Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Hey, Rosalie? Do you know how to drown a blonde? Stick a mirror to the bottom of a pool.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: They slipped briskly into an intimacy from which they never recovered.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: No! Please! I'll tell you whatever you want to know! the man yelled.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: I sent the club a wire stating, PLEASE ACCEPT MY RESIGNATION. I DON'T WANT TO BELONG TO ANY CLUB THAT WILL ACCEPT ME AS A MEMBER.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Hey, said Shadow. Huginn or Muninn, or whoever you are.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: And next time you're planning to injure yourself to get me attention, just remember that a little sweet talk works wonders.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: That wasn't any act of God. That was an act of pure human fuckery.
author: Stephen King

quote: Just because you're beautiful and perfect, it's made you conceited.
author: William Goldman

quote: Sections in the bookstore
author: Italo Calvino

quote: You see, that is the sad, sorry, terrible thing about sarcasm.
author: Brandon Sanderson

quote: A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Harry, don't go picking a row with Malfoy, don't forget, he's a prefect now, he could make life difficult for you...
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The Little Boy and the Old Man
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: I guess its true what they say, observed Jace. There are no straight men in the trenches.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Inconceivable!
author: William Goldman

quote: I think I've discovered the secret of life -- you just hang around until you get used to it.
author: Charles Schultz

quote: So what? All writers are lunatics!
author: Cornelia Funke

quote: For instance, this new idea that You-Know-Who can kill with a single glance from his eyes. Thats a basilisk, listeners. One simple test: Check whether the thing thats glaring at you has got legs. If it has, its safe to look into its eyes, although if it really is You-Know-Who, thats still likely to be the last thing you ever do.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Four flips the gun in this hand, presses the barrel to Peter's forehead, and clicks a bullet into place. Peter freezes with his lips parted, the yawn dead in his mouth. Wake. Up, Four snaps. You are holding a loaded gun, you idiot. Act like it.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: A literary academic can no more pass a bookstore than an alcoholic can pass a bar.
author: Amanda Cross

quote: Takes a lot of tries before you hit perfection. He paused to reconsider that. Well, except for my parents. They got it on the first try. (Adrian)
author: Richelle Mead

quote: You can safely assume you've created God in your own image when it turns out that God hates all the same people you do.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: She'd also called me brave...unless she was talking to the catfish.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: When beetles fight these battles in a bottle with their paddles
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Hercules,huh? Percy frowned. That guy was like the Starbucks of Ancient Greece. Everywhere you turn--there he is.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: I had a boyfriend who told me Id never succeed, never be nominated for a Grammy, never have a hit song, and that he hoped Id fail. I said to him, Someday, when were not together, you wont be able to order a cup of coffee at the fucking deli without hearing or seeing me.
author: Lady Gaga

quote: Man, you weigh a freaking ton, he told me. What've you been eating, rocks?
author: James Patterson

quote: Humanity takes itself too seriously. It is the world's original sin. If the cave-man had known how to laugh, History would have been different.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: People assume that time is a strict progression of cause to effect, but *actually* from a non-linear, non-subjective viewpoint - it's more like a big ball of wibbly wobbly... time-y wimey... stuff.
author: Steven Moffat

quote: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a purpose.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: Humor is almost always anger with its make-up on.
author: Stephen King

quote: I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: Life is worth living as long as there's a laugh in it.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

quote: The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: Basia coquum, Simon said. Or whatever their motto is.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: To be is to do - Socrates
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: What do I wear in bed? Why, Chanel No. 5, of course
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: We did it, we bashed them wee Potter's the one, and Voldy's gone moldy, so now let's have fun!
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Life sucks, and then you die...
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: ...disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business....
author: Tom Robbins

quote: I don't do what I'm told, but I might do what you want if you ask me nicely.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Going round and around inside a dryer can be fatal, whereas pasta is rarely fatal. Unless Isabelle makes it.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Is this Clarissa Fray? The voice on the other end of the phone sounded familiar, though not immediately identifiable.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I don't mean to be rude he began, in a tone that threatened rudeness in every syllable.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Why it's simply impassible!
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Touch her, and I'll freeze your testicles off and put them in a jar. Understand?
author: Julie Kagawa

quote: Half of seeming clever is keeping your mouth shut at the right times.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

quote: Y'all smoke to enjoy it. I smoke to die.
author: John Green

quote: Sometimes the sins you haven't committed are all you have left to hold onto.
author: David Sedaris

quote: Did you like question ten, Moony? asked Sirius as they emerged into the entrance hall.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: We only came close to dying six or seven times, which I thought was pretty good. Once, I lost my grip and found myself dangling by one hand from a ledge fifty feet above the rocky surf. But I found another handhold and kept climbing. A minute later Annabeth hit a slippery patch of moss and her foot slipped. Fortunately, she found something else to put it against. Unfortunately, that something was my face.

quote: Harry  I think I've just understood something! I've got to go to the library!

quote: Sometimes you just have to pee in the sink.

Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them.

quote: I never made one of my discoveries through the process of rational thinking

quote: A towel, [The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy] says, is about the most massively useful thing an interstellar hitchhiker can have. Partly it has great practical value. You can wrap it around you for warmth as you bound across the cold moons of Jaglan Beta; you can lie on it on the brilliant marble-sanded beaches of Santraginus V, inhaling the heady sea vapors; you can sleep under it beneath the stars which shine so redly on the desert world of Kakrafoon; use it to sail a miniraft down the slow heavy River Moth; wet it for use in hand-to-hand-combat; wrap it round your head to ward off noxious fumes or avoid the gaze of the Ravenous Bugblatter Beast of Traal (such a mind-boggingly stupid animal, it assumes that if you can't see it, it can't see you); you can wave your towel in emergencies as a distress signal, and of course dry yourself off with it if it still seems to be clean enough.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: I love new clothes. If everyone could just wear new clothes everyday, I reckon depression wouldnt exist anymore.

quote: Because children have abounding vitality, because they are in spirit fierce and free, therefore they want things repeated and unchanged. They always say, Do it again; and the grown-up person does it again until he is nearly dead. For grown-up people are not strong enough to exult in monotony. But perhaps God is strong enough to exult in monotony. It is possible that God says every morning, Do it again to the sun; and every evening, Do it again to the moon. It may not be automatic necessity that makes all daisies alike; it may be that God makes every daisy separately, but has never got tired of making them. It may be that He has the eternal appetite of infancy; for we have sinned and grown old, and our Father is younger than we.

quote: The children now love luxury; they have bad manners, contempt for authority; they show disrespect for elders and love chatter in place of exercise. They contradict their parents, chatter before company, gobble up dainties at the table, cross their legs, and tyrannize their teachers.

quote: Adam was but humanthis explains it all. He did not want the apple for the apple's sake, he wanted it only because it was forbidden. The mistake was in not forbidding the serpent; then he would have eaten the serpent.

quote: If its true that our species is alone in the universe, then Id have to say the universe aimed rather low and settled for very little.

quote: Before I could figure out how to apologize for being such an idiot, she tackled me with a hug, then pulled away just as quickly. I'm glad you're not a guinea pig.

quote: You know what the fellow said  in Italy, for thirty years under the Borgias, they had warfare, terror, murder and bloodshed, but they produced Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci and the Renaissance. In Switzerland, they had brotherly love, they had five hundred years of democracy and peace  and what did that produce? The cuckoo clock.

quote: Never knock on death's door. Ring the doorbell then run. He totally hates that.

quote: The idea of being strong for someone else having never entered their heads, I find myself in the position of having to console them. Since I'm the person going in to be slaughtered, this is somewhat annoying.

quote: Soap?

quote: Sane is boring.

quote: Great, tell me when you've defeated Voldemort for me, will you?

quote: So why in the name of Merlins saggy left
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: There was only one catch and that was Catch-22, which specified that a concern for one's safety in the face of dangers that were real and immediate was the process of a rational mind. Orr was crazy and could be grounded. All he had to do was ask; and as soon as he did, he would no longer be crazy and would have to fly more missions. Orr would be crazy to fly more missions and sane if he didn't, but if he was sane he had to fly them. If he flew them he was crazy and didn't have to; but if he didn't want to he was sane and had to. Yossarian was moved very deeply by the absolute simplicity of this clause of Catch-22 and let out a respectful whistle.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: Well, Tessa said, sighting along the line of the knife, you behave as if you dislike me. In fact, you behave as if you dislike us all.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: He had just about enough intelligence to open his mouth when he wanted to eat, but certainly no more.
author: P.G. Wodehouse

quote: Sometimes, just saying that you hate something, and having someone agree with you, can make you feel better about a terrible situation.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: Sometimes the road less traveled is less traveled for a reason
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: He attacked everything in life with a mix of extraordinary genius and naive incompetence, and it was often difficult to tell which was which.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: I never worry about diets. The only carrots that interest me are the number you get in a diamond.
author: Mae West

quote: I just got out of the hospital. I was in a speed reading accident. I hit a book mark and flew across the room.
author: Steven Wright

quote: I took a test in Existentialism. I left all the answers blank and got 100.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Look on the bright side, said Simon, If they need a human sacrifice, you can always offer me. I'm not sure the rest of you qualify anyway.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: We were not a hugging people. In terms of emotional comfort it was our belief that no amount of physical contact could match the healing powers of a well made cocktail.
author: David Sedaris

quote: The love of books is among the choicest gifts of the gods.
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: I felt like an animal, and animals dont know sin, do they?
author: Jess C. Scott

quote: What are you grinning at? Katsa demanded for the third or fourth time. Is the ceiling about to cave in on my head or something? You look like we're both on the verge of an enormous joke.
author: Kristin Cashore

quote: You must admit I have a right to live in a pigsty if I want.
author: Diana Wynne Jones

quote: Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Then you're aping him. Valentine was one of the most arrogant and disrespectful men I've ever met. I suppose he brought you up to be just like him.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Try not to have a good time...this is supposed to be educational.
author: Charles Schultz

quote: Blackjack, Percy said, this is Piper and Jason. They're friends.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: You could start a fire with the heat between you two.
author: Michelle Hodkin

quote: It unscrews the other way.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: I'm sorry. I use my rapier wit to hide my inner pain.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Well, we were always going to fail that one, said Ron gloomily as they ascended the marble staircase. He had just made Harry feel rather better by telling him how he told the examiner in detail about the ugly man with a wart on his nose in the crystal ball, only to look up and realize he had been describing the examiner's reflection.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: It's okay, I said soothingly. You're just getting your stride back. Once you're up to full power, I'll go crack a rib or something so we can test it.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Nobody's ever asked me to a party before, as a friend. Is that why you dyed your eyebrow, for the party? Should I do mine too?
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I think the warning labels on alcoholic beverages are too bland. They should be more vivid. Here is one I would suggest: Alcohol will turn you into the same asshole your father was.
author: George Carlin

quote: Aziraphale collected books. If he were totally honest with himself he would have to have admitted that his bookshop was simply somewhere to store them. He was not unusual in this. In order to maintain his cover as a typical second-hand book seller, he used every means short of actual physical violence to prevent customers from making a purchase. Unpleasant damp smells, glowering looks, erratic opening hours - he was incredibly good at it.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Write it. Shoot it. Publish it. Crochet it, saut it, whatever. MAKE.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: Delaying death is one of my favorite hobbies
author: Rick Riordan

quote: What is it with you today? says Christina on the way to breakfast. Her eyes are still
author: Veronica Roth

quote: This is my knife. It is very sharp and very eager to hurt you.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: If a black cat crosses your path, it signifies that the animal is going somewhere.
author: Groucho marx

quote: This book was written using 100% recycled words.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Procrastinate now, don't put it off.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Two hundred Romans, and no ones got a pen? Never mind!
author: Rick Riordan

quote: ...inside every old person is a young person wondering what happened.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Alas! Earwax!
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: We who think we are about to die will laugh at anything.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: If there was anything that depressed him more than his own cynicism, it was that quite often it still wasn't as cynical as real life.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: It has often been said
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: If you haven't got anything nice to say about anybody come sit next to me.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

quote: That would be a good thing for them to cut on my tombstone: Wherever she went, including here, it was against her better judgment.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: When I was growing up I always wanted to be someone. Now I realize I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: They lie about marijuana. Tell you pot-smoking makes you unmotivated. Lie! When you're high, you can do everything you normally do just as well  you just realize that it's not worth the fucking effort. There is a difference.
author: Bill Hicks

quote: You're going to burn in a very special level of hell. A level they reserve for child molesters and people who talk at the theater.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: I should never be left alone with my mind for too long.
author: Libba Bray

quote: You're a stalker with hooves.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: This isn't life in the fast lane, it's life in the oncoming traffic.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Did you ever want to set someone's head on fire, just to see what it looked like? Did you ever stand in the street and think to yourself, I could make that nun go blind just by giving her a kiss? Did you ever lay out plans for stitching babies and stray cats into a Perfect New Human? Did you ever stand naked surrounded by people who want your gleaming sperm, squirting frankincense, soma and testosterone from every pore? If so, then you're the bastard who stole my drugs Friday night. And I'll find you. Oh, yes.
author: Warren Ellis

quote: He hoped and prayed that there wasn't an afterlife. Then he realized there was a contradiction involved here and merely hoped that there wasn't an afterlife.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: When life gives you lemons, chunk it right back.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: It can hardly be a coincidence that no language on earth has ever produced the expression, 'As pretty as an airport.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: I'm the Super-sized McShizzle, man! Leo said. I'm Leo Valdez, bad boy supreme. And the ladies
author: rick riordan

quote: If something is going to happen to me, I want to be there.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Ask me no questions, and I'll tell you no fibs.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: It's now very common to hear people say, 'I'm rather offended by that.' As if that gives them certain rights. It's actually nothing more... than a whine. 'I find that offensive.' It has no meaning; it has no purpose; it has no reason to be respected as a phrase. 'I am offended by that.' Well, so fucking what.
author: Stephen Fry

quote: Carpe Scrotum. Seize life by the testicles
author: Rowena Cherry

quote: Relax, having kids is years away. But can you imagine? Your brains, my charm, our collective good looks... then add in the usual physical abilities dhampirs get.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Fine! I'll throw on some clothes. Turn around. I'm in my pj's
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Isn't it funny how the memories you cherish before a breakup can become your worst enemies afterwards? The thoughts you loved to think about, the memories you wanted to hold up to the light and view from every angle--it suddenly seems a lot safer to lock them in a box, far from the light of day and throw away the key. It's not an act of bitterness. It's an act if self-preservation. It's not always a bad idea to stay behind the window and look out at life instead, is it?
author: Allyson Braithwaite Condie

quote: Take off your shirt.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Take some more tea, the March Hare said to Alice, very earnestly.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: I've always thought people would find a lot more pleasure in their routines if they burst into song at significant moments.
author: John Barrowman

quote: How is it possible to have a civil war?
author: George Carlin

quote: Student: Dr. Einstein, Aren't these the same questions as last year's [physics] final exam?
author: Albert Einstein

quote: In life you'll meet a lot of jerks. If they hurt you, tell yourself that it's because they're stupid. That will help keep you from reacting to their cruelty. Because there is nothing worse than bitterness and vengeance... Always keep your dignity and be true to yourself.
author: Marjane Satrapi

quote: I am your Prince and you will marry me, Humperdinck said.
author: William Goldman

quote: What about a compromise? Ill kill them first, and if it turns out they were friendly, Ill apologize.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: The Council agrees, Zeus said. Percy Jackson, you will have one gift from the gods.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Do you know what breakfast cereal is made of? It's made of all those little curly wooden shavings you find in pencil sharpeners!
author: Roald Dahl

quote: This is Leo. I'm the... What's my title? Am I like, admiral, or captain, or...
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Reyna sent me to get Percy, Frank said. Did Octavian accept you?
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Always be wary of any helpful item that weighs less than its operating manual.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Everybody finished the song at different times. At last, only the Weasley twins were left singing along to a very slow funeral march.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: Have any of you wondered what I did with all the cash Pekka Rollins gave us?
author: Leigh Bardugo

quote: I imagine hell like this: Italian punctuality, German humour and English wine.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: It's probably a bad indicator of your lifestyle when you miss your ex-boyfriend because he's absolutely lethal.
author: Charlaine Harris

quote: I heard the man and woman cry a warning as I frantically racked my brain for some sort of throat-repairing spell, which I was clearly about to need. Of course the only words that I actually managed to yell at the werewolf as he ran at me were, 'BAD DOG!'
author: Rachel Hawkins

quote: A gun. I had been brought down by a gun. It was practically comical. Cheaters, I thought.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: You wanted to lick my face the first time you saw me? Is that usually what you do when youre attracted to guys?
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: Poison! Grover yelped. Don't let those things touch you or...
author: Rick Riordan

quote: You're only a man! You've not our gifts! I can tell you! Why, a woman can think of a hundred different things at once, all them contradictory!
author: Georgette Heyer

quote: I try to stay in a constant state of confusion just because of the expression it leaves on my face.
author: Johnny Depp

quote: You sneaked into my cabin?
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Marry, and you will regret it; dont marry, you will also regret it; marry or dont marry, you will regret it either way. Laugh at the worlds foolishness, you will regret it; weep over it, you will regret that too; laugh at the worlds foolishness or weep over it, you will regret both. Believe a woman, you will regret it; believe her not, you will also regret it Hang yourself, you will regret it; do not hang yourself, and you will regret that too; hang yourself or dont hang yourself, youll regret it either way; whether you hang yourself or do not hang yourself, you will regret both. This, gentlemen, is the essence of all philosophy.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Practice makes perfect, but nobody's perfect, so why practice?
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: The Queen's Pride was his ship, and he loved her. (That was the way his sentences always went: It is raining today and I love you. My cold is better and I love you. Say hello to Horse and I love you. Like that.)
author: William Goldman

quote: Are you sleepwalking?' A voice asked behind me.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: How did you become blind, uh, Jeff is it?
author: James Patterson

quote: Well, art is art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water! And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now, uh... now you tell me what you know.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: I'm tired of this back-slappin' isn't humanity neat bullshit. We're a virus with shoes.
author: Bill Hicks

quote: Reality is just a crutch for people who can't handle drugs.
author: Robin  Williams

quote: Who knows how to make love stay?
author: Tom Robbins

quote: You can live to be a hundred if you give up all the things that make you want to live to be a hundred.
author: Woody Allen

quote: The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity.
author: Harlan Ellison

quote: No one in the world gets what they want and that is beautiful.
author: Ernest Cline

quote: I don't accept the currently fashionable assertion that any view is automatically as worthy of respect as any equal and opposite view. My view is that the moon is made of rock. If someone says to me 'Well, you haven't been there, have you? You haven't seen it for yourself, so my view that it is made of Norwegian Beaver Cheese is equally valid' - then I can't even be bothered to argue. There is such a thing as the burden of proof, and in the case of god, as in the case of the composition of the moon, this has shifted radically. God used to be the best explanation we'd got, and we've now got vastly better ones. God is no longer an explanation of anything, but has instead become something that would itself need an insurmountable amount of explaining. So I don't think that being convinced that there is no god is as irrational or arrogant a point of view as belief that there is. I don't think the matter calls for even-handedness at all.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Do you think it's possible for an entire nation to be insane?
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: One should always be in love. That's the reason one should never marry.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A good night sleep, or a ten minute bawl, or a pint of chocolate ice cream, or all three together, is good medicine.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Everybody going to be dead one day, just give them time.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: It's lovely. If only you could frost someone to death.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile, hoping it will eat him last.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: How do I know you'll keep your word? asked Coraline.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Eat a live frog first thing in the morning and nothing worse will happen to you the rest of the day.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Hermione launched herself forwards and started punching every inch of him that she could reach.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: They're book addicts.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: Erre es korakas, Blinky! Dionysus cursed. I will have your soul!
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Anybody who has survived his childhood has enough information about life to last him the rest of his days.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: As I am sure you know, when people say 'It's my pleasure,' they usually mean something along the lines of, 'There's nothing on Earth I would rather do less.' [...]
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: I look up to say something but he puts his finger to my lips and whispers, Dont talk. Youll just spoil my fantasy of rescuing an innocent damsel in distress as soon as you open your mouth.
author: Susan Ee

quote: I couldn't believe I'd come this far, lost Tyson, suffered through so much, only to fail - stopped by a big stupid monster in a baby-blue tuxedo kilt. Nobody was going to swat down my friends like that! I mean...nobody, not Nobody. Ah, you know what I mean.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: I'll be famous one day, but for now I'm stuck in middle school with a bunch of morons. - Greg Heffley,
author: Jeff Kinney

quote: I find my life is a lot easier the lower I keep my expectations.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: Mythologically speaking, if there's anything I hate worse than trios of old ladies, it's bulls. Last summer, I fought the Minotaur on top of Half-Blood Hill. This time what I saw up there was even worse: two bulls. And not just regular bulls - bronze ones the size of elephants. And even that wasn't bad enough. Naturally they had to breathe fire, too.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Q: You'er presented with a smooth-faced, eight-foot-high wooden wall. Your objective? Get over it. To, like, save comrades or something. How to accomplish this?
author: James Patterson

quote: We could visit him, suggests Will. But what would we say? 'I didn't know you that well, but I'm sorry you got stabbed in the eye'?
author: Veronica Roth

quote: We must have a pie. Stress cannot exist in the presence of a pie.
author: David Mamet

quote: Someday I must read this scholar Everyone. He seems to have written so much--all of it wrong.
author: Tamora Pierce

quote: Life is a journey. Time is a river. The door is ajar
author: Jim Butcher

quote: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells.
author: Dr Suess

quote: In Ireland, you go to someone's house, and she asks you if you want a cup of tea. You say no, thank you, you're really just fine. She asks if you're
author: C.E. Murphy

quote: Think, think, think.
author: A.A. Milne

quote: You are your mother's trueborn son of Lannister.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: I'm Draco Malfoy, I'm Draco, I'm on your side!
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Then you remember the dream, Mencheres stated. That bodes ill.
author: Jeaniene Frost

quote: I never made a mistake in my life; at least, never one that I couldn't explain away afterwards.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: We are not going to die.
author: Jim Butcher

quote: Being a detective isn't all about torture and murder and monsters. Sometimes it gets truly unpleasant...The fate of the world may depend on whether or not you can bring yourself to visit your relatives.
author: Derek Landy

quote: Telling an introvert to go to a party is like telling a saint to go to Hell.
author: Criss Jami

quote: A great nose may be an index
author: Edmond Rostand

quote: Love is where you find it. I think it is foolish to go around looking for it, and I think it can be poisonous. I wish that people who are conventionally supposed to love each other would say to each other, when they fight, 'Please  a little less love, and a little more common decency'.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Yes, the long war on Christianity. I pray that one day we may live in an America where Christians can worship freely! In broad daylight! Openly wearing the symbols of their religion... perhaps around their necks? And maybe -- dare I dream it? -- maybe one day there can be an openly Christian President. Or, perhaps, 43 of them. Consecutively.
author: Jon Stewart

quote: Name the different kinds of people, said Miss Lupescu. Now.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Statistically speaking, there is a 65 percent chance that the love of your life is having an affair. Be very suspicious.
author: Scott Dikkers

quote: V-Dayif you need this one day in a year to show everyone else you truly care for your loved one I think its quite stupid. I hate this commercialism. Its all artificial, and has nothing to do with real love.
author: Jess C Scott

quote: I have only made this letter longer because I have not had the time to make it shorter.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: It is a good rule in life never to apologize. The right sort of people do not want apologies, and the wrong sort take a mean advantage of them.
author: P.G. Wodehouse

quote: Haven't you ever heard that modesty is an attractive trait?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: If our Founding Fathers wanted us to care about the rest of the world, they wouldn't have declared their independence from it.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: A fire broke out backstage in a theatre. The clown came out to warn the public; they thought it was a joke and applauded. He repeated it; the acclaim was even greater. I think that's just how the world will come to an end: to general applause from wits who believe it's a joke.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Now, Max, I think we both know your parents aren't missionaries.
author: James Patterson

quote: Congratulations!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Do you mean ter tell me, he growled at the Dursleys, that this boythis boy!knows nothin' abou'about ANYTHING?
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Awww, Minho said. That's almost as sweet as that time she slammed the end of a spear into your shuck face.
author: James Dashner

quote: I didn't know that idiocy caused people to just start spontaneously bleeding from the nose.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them.
author: Stephen Fry

quote: I don't like it when I outweigh my men.
author: Patricia Briggs

quote: Wait. Why am I thinking about Krispy Kremes? Were supposed to be exercising.
author: Meg Cabot

quote: The Death Eaters can't all be pure-blood, there aren't enough pure-blood wizards left, said Hermione stubbornly. I expect most of them are half-bloods pretending to be pure. It's only Muggle-borns they hate, they'd be quite happy to let you and Ron join up
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: There are never enough 'I love you's.
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: Magic
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: Brevity is the soul of lingerie.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: The person who writes for fools is always sure of a large audience.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Once I had a rose named after me and I was very flattered. But I was not pleased to read the description in the catalogue: No good in a bed, but fine up against a wall.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: 25 And the Lord spake unto the Angel that guarded the eastern gate, saying 'Where is the flaming sword that was given unto thee?'
author: Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett

quote: I love to sleep. Do you? Isn't it great? It really is the best of both worlds. You get to be alive and unconscious.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: If you aren't cute, you may as well be clever.
author: David Sedaris

quote: If you had a million years to do it in, you couldn't rub out even half the Fuck you signs in the world. It's impossible.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: If we're going to the Silent City, you might want to get dressed. I mean, I appreciate the bra-and-panties look, but I don't know if the Silent Brothers will. There are only a few of the left, and I don't want them to die of excitement.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The entire universe has been neatly divided into things to (a) mate with, (b) eat, (c) run away from, and (d) rocks.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: If somebody says 'I love you' to me, I feel as though I had a pistol pointed at my head. What can anybody reply under such conditions but that which the pistol holder requires? 'I love you, too'.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Some of the worst mistakes in my life were haircuts
author: Jim Morrison

quote: It doesn't matter if they hate you, or embarrass you, or simply don't appreciate your genius for inventing the internet-
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Busy' is another word for 'asshole'. 'Asshole' is another word for the guy you're dating.
author: Greg Behrendt

quote: You can only be in a bad mood for so long before you have to face up to the fact that it isn't a bad mood at all; it's just your sucky personality.
author: Megan McCafferty

quote: Fresh is better. But you've never drunk fresh blood. Have you?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Leo couldn't help smiling. That could be fun.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Hes not feeling well, Clary said, catching at Simons wrist. Were going.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I've had great success being a total idiot.
author: Jerry Lewis

quote: The mind is a complex and many-layered thing, Potter... or at least, most minds are...
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I require three things in a man: he must be handsome, ruthless, and stupid.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Boys. I'd turn gay if they weren't so sexy.
author: Rachel Caine

quote: Red hair, sir, in my opinion, is dangerous.
author: P.G. Wodehouse

quote: They laugh at me because I'm different; I laugh at them because they're all the same.
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: So I hear we get to go to town this weekend. Want to catch a movie or something?
author: Ally Carter

quote: Until a man is twenty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he could be the baddest motherfucker in the world. If I moved to a martial-arts monastery in China and studied real hard for ten years. If my family was wiped out by Colombian drug dealers and I swore myself to revenge. If I got a fatal disease, had one year to live, and devoted it to wiping out street crime. If I just dropped out and devoted my life to being bad.
author: Neal Stephenson

quote: Crap, are you thinking what I'm thinking?
author: Rachel Caine

quote: Its sarcasm, Josh.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: There are moments, Jeeves, when one asks oneself, 'Do trousers matter?'
author: P.G. Wodehouse

quote: Although I was able to maintain a pleasant expression, I was mentally throwing up in her face.
author: Augusten Burroughs

quote: That woman speaks eighteen languages, and can't say 'No' in any of them.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: I think hiccup cures were really invented for the amusement of the patient's friends.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: You have to remember one thing about the will of the people: it wasn't that long ago that we were swept away by the Macarena.
author: Jon Stewart

quote: And yet another moral occurs to me now: Make love when you can. It's good for you.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Just give me a second. Attempting to give a fuck...Attempting harder to give a fuck...Sorry, there was an error; fuck not given.
author: Suzanne  Wright

quote: I'm going to talk to her.
author: J.R. Ward

quote: Any fool can make a rule
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Here is a lesson in creative writing.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: My way of joking is to tell the truth. It's the funniest joke in the world.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A well-read woman is a dangerous creature.
author: Lisa Kleypas

quote: Ive been drunk for about a week now, and I thought it might sober me up to sit in a library.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: These books can't possibly compete with centuries of established history, especially when that history is endorsed by the ultimate bestseller of all time.
author: Dan Brown

quote: You were wrong. She really is the new general in town.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Frank stared at him. Unfair? You can breathe underwater and blow up glaciers and summon freaking hurricanes-and it's unfair that I can be an elephant?
author: Rick Riordan

quote: If I shot an arrow and thought about an ass, would it surprise you if it hit Erik?
author: P.C. Cast, Kristin Cast

quote: Run first,' Shane said. 'Mourn later.'
author: Rachel Caine

quote: I wasn't fooled. He was avoiding looking at me. There's nothing to talk about.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: I can't go on, I'll go on.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Is there any point asking what you're going to make me do on Sunday?'
author: Michelle Hodkin

quote: Leo lowered his screwdriver. He looked at the ceiling and shook his head like, What am I gonna do with this guy?
author: Rick Riordan

quote: I hate you, I muttered.
author: Michelle Hodkin

quote: His Majesty needs a can-I girl anyway. And I'm not it.
author: Ilona Andrews

quote: I've begun worshipping the sun for a number of reasons. First of all, unlike some other gods I could mention, I can see the sun. It's there for me every day. And the things it brings me are quite apparent all the time: heat, light, food, and a lovely day. There's no mystery, no one asks for money, I don't have to dress up, and there's no boring pageantry. And interestingly enough, I have found that the prayers I offer to the sun and the prayers I formerly offered to 'God' are all answered at about the same 50% rate.
author: George Carlin

quote: Bad news, Harry. I've just been to see Professor McGonagall about the Firebolt. She  er, got a bit shirty with me. Told me I'd got my priorities wrong. Seemed to think I cared more about winning the Cup than I do about staying alive. Just because I told her I didn't care if it threw you off, as long as you caught the Snitch first.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: You're not a woman, he said finally. You're the Grim Reaper with red hair!
author: Jeaniene Frost

quote: The caterpillar does all the work, but the butterfly gets all the publicity.
author: George Carlin

quote: We're not retreating, we're advancing in reverse.' --Skulduggery Pleasant
author: Derek Landy

quote: What to do if you find yourself stuck in a crack in the ground underneath a giant boulder you can't move, with no hope of rescue. Consider how lucky you are that life has been good to you so far. Alternatively, if life hasn't been good to you so far, which given your current circumstances seems more likely, consider how lucky you are that it won't be troubling you much longer.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Fate, Blue replied, glowering at her mother, is a very weighty word to throw around before breakfast.
author: Maggie Stiefvater

quote: He f**ks even better than he looks, I settled on saying. Several heads turned. I didnt care; I was pissed. And that beautiful face is going to be clamped between my legs as soon as we get home, dont you worry.
author: Jeaniene Frost

quote: I celebrated Thanksgiving in an old-fashioned way. I invited everyone in my neighborhood to my house, we had an enormous feast, and then I killed them and took their land.

quote: In America, anyone can become president. That's the problem.
author: George Carlin

quote: You're Hell's Angels, then? What chapter are you from?'
author: Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett

quote: But the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: I'm right and you're wrong, I'm big and you're small, and there's nothing you can do about it.

quote: Have you ever had a girlfriend, Kenji?

quote: Just give me a comfortable couch, a dog, a good book, and a woman. Then if you can get the dog to go somewhere and read the book, I might have a little fun.
